boardgame.name: True Love ~Jun'ai Monogatari~
boardgame.description:
True Love ~Jun'ai Monogatari~ (TRUE LOVE ～純愛物語～), better known simply as True Love, is a Japanese erotic dating sim developed by Software House Parsley and published by CD Bros., released on June 9, 1995 for the PC-98[2] and on December 6, 1996 for Windows.[3] It was localized in Europe by Otaku Publishing and distributed in North America by JAST USA in January 1999.[4]

Unlike traditional, even modern visual novels, which are characteristically uninvolved beyond the periodic decision to make, True Love incorporates elements reminiscent of a role-playing game, for which it is also occasionally categorized.

The game is played through a series of virtual days, consecutively spanning three months. At the start of each morning, players designate an activity to pursue for evening, night, and in the case of weekends or vacation, daytime: studying, practicing art, exercising, grooming, recreation, taking a break, going to work, shopping or fulfilling a promise. Each choice affects the overall being of the player at the conclusion of the day, and points are distributed among stats for passion, appearance, fatigue, scholarship, strength and art. Depending on the level of these stats, and the order of schedules made during particular days, the player will shift their romantic focus and possibly trigger nonlinear events and encounters over time. In addition, working generates income and shopping allows the player to voluntarily spend their money on items for themselves or to give as gifts.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/True_Love_%28game%29 True Love (game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Wonderful Everyday ~Diskontinuierliches Dasein~
boardgame.description:
Story

"Down the Rabbit-Hole" - a story of the sky and the world.

One day, Minakami Yuki witnesses a stuffed toy falling through the air.
Battered and worn, how many times has this doll fluttered downwards, released as an attempted offering to the sky?
An offering to the sky - a way to find the "day we return to the sky"; a ritual passed down in this town since times gone by.
Those efforts shall come to fruition in the place where the girls of earth and sky meet.

Vega and Altair, Orihime and Hikoboshi, two points of light separated by the vast Milky Way.
Together with Deneb, crown of the Northern Cross, they make up the Summer Triangle.
Evoking the concept of the Trinity, this formation is also known as the "heavenly triangle".
When this heavenly triangle shines overhead, the world and the sky will meet.

Takashima Zakuro, Wakatsuki Kagami, and Wakatsuki Tsukasa, and our heroine Minakami Yuki set off on the search of that place where the points of the divine triangle cross, where world and sky join together.


Description

Winner in the Best Story category of the 2010 Moe Game Awards, Wonderful Everyday is a beloved visual novel with multiple routes, written by SCA-DI and featuring artwork from Kagome, Motoyone, Suzuri, and karory.

For this international release the visuals of the game have been upgraded to a higher resolution (keeping the same aspect ratio of the original) in order to deliver a more intense and captivating experience from this visual novel masterpiece.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Girl
boardgame.description:
Description

Dungeon Girl is a Puzzle RPG that's easy to pick up and play! Join Monica on her journey down dungeon under the Tower of Light Blue, and conquer over 1000 floors! Match panels to explore the dungeon, and make them disappear to attack enemies. Explore, excavate, heal and attack. Start your adventure and see how deep you can go!

Features:

A strategic puzzle RPG

1000 floors to explore

300 items to craft

200 skills to use

Synthesize and Upgrade your items

boardgame.name: BelloLudi Rifles: Skirmish Game 1860-1914
boardgame.description:
BelloLudi Rifles rules have been developed for people who have no previous experience in wargaming, yet like to play games.
BelloLudi designed these rules especially for team building purposes. It is therefore easy to learn, quick to play, yet difficult to master! Suitable for two to forty players!

The game is designed as a multiplayer game but will work just as fine with only two players or even solo. The same goes for the number of miniatures involved. It is possible to start with only 20-odd miniatures, but that can easily be expanded. Hopefully, playing the game will encourage you to create your own armies. Similarly, the distances are given in inches for use with 28mm scale soldiers. Feel free to adapt to centimetres should you not have the space or when you use a smaller scale of miniatures.

This ruleset simulates battles in the period of 1860 to roughly 1914, the age in which European countries forged empires all over the world and combated each other and the various indigenous people. The rules will work for skirmishes in colonial settings, the Franco-Prussian War and other Wars of German Unification, the Balkan Wars, the Spanish-American War, the Boer Wars, the Boxer Rebellion and other clashes. It will also work for the early clashes of WW1.

Designed for the beginner with a minimum of miniatures, it also allows you to field large armies on the table top and play to a conclusion in two to three hours.

The aim is not to annihilate the enemy unit to the last man, but to inflict so much damage that morale is brought down and the unit will become shaken or will run away in panic and be removed from the table top. By a clever combination of movement and shooting, dashing cavalry charges and carefully positioned artillery pieces, this can be achieved. The tactics are based on teamwork. Not only within a unit, but also between units and as such, the whole army.

This product come with two commander dice. Markers can be downloaded.
Cards are available separately.

—description from the publisher FB page

boardgame.name: Necronautilus
boardgame.description:
Diesel-fueled goliaths flood the planet with their motor oil blood. Living mountains of ivy and thorns reach for remnants of light from a nearby dead sun. 5474N collects malevolent souls to raise an army on the molten chrome planet of Hell. All this and more in the post-death infinite universe of NECRONAUTILUS!

If you like games like Troika!, movies like Guardians of The Galaxy, or music by Spirit Adrift, Ghost, or Black Sabbath, this game is for you.

Necronautilus is designed, written, and illustrated by Adam Vass of World Champ Game Co.

-from the Kickstarter page

boardgame.name: Three Indoor Games: Tank Attack
boardgame.description:
Tank Attack is a simple roll and move game where the aim is to navigate a path from the combat base to the final objective. Along the way obstacles such as tank traps, anti tank guns and enemy bombers will impede a players progress, The first to reach the objective (square 100) is the winner.

The game can be found as part of a 3 game set in an envelope packaging titled, Three Indoor Games, the other games being Snakes and Ladders and Ludo. Published by Ace Games in Australia during the Second World War.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Star Arena: Arcade Chess
boardgame.description:
Arcade-Chess is a Game-Of-Generals, invented to teach New-Players how to 'Move over the Maps' within the StarArena_MetaVerse and get you acquainted with how to Operate the Battle-Clones in Close Quarters Combat.

The working theory is: "Having practiced and getting good at this Battle-Simulation will give you Strategic-Advantage when playing Missions on Larger-Maps!"

If you are a fan of Abstract War-Games? This could very well give you hours of Table-Top~Fun and keep you entertained for Years to Come!

(Will extend description later when approved)

boardgame.name: Treasure Island
boardgame.description:
Treasure Island is a roll and move game first published during the 1920s in Australia. Players follow a path of 41 squares through the sea passing various ports along the way until you reach Treasure Island. There you roll specific numbers in order to collect treasure and acquire a ship to take you on a course of 31 squares for home.

Along the way contrary winds can detour your journey, you can drift off course, hit rocks and get wrecked, all of which make returning to home more difficult. First home is the winner.

At least 2 versions exist. A version resides in the Australian National Martime Museum, Sydney, with somewhat simpler graphics and classified as first edition

—user summary

boardgame.name: Gunfight Royale
boardgame.description:
Players battle to the last gunfighter standing using dice, cards, poker chips, and miniature figures sculpted in the style of vintage cartoons. Players choose between twelve very distinct characters whose special abilities must be considered carefully depending on the scenario drawn and the choices made by opponents. Found items and dirty trick cards are used to surprise and outwit opponents, while the figures and board encourage players to use sound tactics.
After being eliminated from the game, a player can continue to influence play through their dirty trick cards, so nobody is left out.
The game ends when only one character remains standing, or a miniature on horseback reaches the end of the time track. At the end of the game, the winner is determined by the total bounties of opponents eliminated, plus bonuses for found items and scenario objectives.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Star Arena: Cyber-Combat Card & Boardgame
boardgame.description:
StarArena_The Card Game is an Outrageous & Gratuitous Web-Published Cyber-War Collectable-Card-Game (CCG) featuring #GodsViciousBabies!

The Card Game is a collection of random War-Stories converted to Battle-Cards that take place in the StarArena_MetaVerse. You are required to build an Attack-Stack (Game-Deck a/o Data-Base) with the prime-directive to 'Destroy' all other opponents Data-Bases!




= = = = =
When Played with MODEM:

Your mission for the base-game is to 'obliterate' the other player(s in card-combat, and the win-conditions are divided into 2 types of counters: Lives & Wins.

You have to think of it like; Playing an Arcade-Game!
Lives are Lost in Card-Battle and gained by Insert-Coin into the pot, 1 Coin gives you 3 Lives. Losing a single Card-Battle, means you Loose A Life: -1. The counter is the set to -1, when you loose your last Life; You are Out-Game and the Victor in that Card-Battle has just gained a Game-Win! And that players Win-Counter is set to: +1.

The first Player to reach 6 Wins on his/her counter gets to Chant:
Whois the #GunShin? #軍神? ...And is the War-Hero/God of that Game!!

Taking home the'Treasure' _ie: Game-Coins_ that has/have accumulated in the pot during Game-Play!!!

When the Players are not done with game-play for the day or night?
All Data-Bases are reshuffled (random-access-memory) and Counters reset to Minimum and a new Game-Session begins with the target to: Reach 6 Wins First and become the next Gunshin!!

Each player who wants to participate in Battle: Must Insert-Coin (Maximum stakes are 2 Coins, giving 6 Lives) into the Pot and draw a Hero-Card from hand and place in Modem (or Active HW Location) at the beginning of their game-turn.
StarArena is a Multi-Player Collectable-Card-Game and is best played with 4 to 8 Players and the higher the chance becomes to reach 6 Game-Wins and proclaim to be the Gunshin!



= = = = =

The 'Only' really important thing you need to know before building an Attack-Stack is:
There are 2 Types of General-Cards: Hardware-Cards & Software-Cards!

Hardware are your Hero-Cards and have: Dual-Hard-Drives and signify your Download-Capacity & Battle-Values. (Blow through these in Card-Battle and you suffer Defeat!

Software are your Battle-Options and have: A Download-Cost, Free-Space needed to Activate SW a/o APP. (These Battle-Cards Make-Or-Break your chances of Victory!

A Deck may contain a maximum of 64 cards and no-less than 8 game cards.
For the nitty-gritty on Card-Battle-Rules read: ROE, Rules-Of-Engagement.

Oh, ...and did I mention; It is a !!FREE!! Print_And_Play game?
Check-Out the link below and Build Yourself a Bad-Ass Data-Base.

And Become A Man Amongst Babies!
Just Don't Tell Your Mom?

boardgame.name: UNO: The Lion King
boardgame.description:
It's the classic card game you know, now with a Lion King theme! UNO Lion King features a colorful deck with images of beloved characters from the original Disney movie -- Simba, Timon, Pumba and more -- as well as a special Lion King-themed rule that could change the entire direction of the game! Just like in classic UNO, match cards by color or number and play action cards like Skip, Reverse and Wild Draw Four to shake up the competition. When the Circle of Life card is played, cards pass in a circle from player to player. Score points by being the first to get rid of all the cards in your hand and when you're down to one card, don't forget to roar, "UNO!" This version of the family-favorite card game makes a great gift for 7 year olds and up. Colors and decorations may vary.

It's the classic card game you know, now with a Lion King theme!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: UNO: Incredibles 2
boardgame.description: This special deck includes the Wild Screen Slaver Card, which hypnotizes cards and adds a fun twist to the game!

boardgame.name: UNO: Toy Story
boardgame.description: Play UNO to infinity and beyond with Woody, Buzz, and the toys from Andy's room. Become the master of the aliens with the special Claw card and rule! And be sure to yell "UNO!" when you're about to reach for the sky and win!

boardgame.name: Machina Arcana: Game Mats
boardgame.description:
The Game Mats contain:

4 Player mats (65×20 cm each) - one for each player to place their player board and inventory,
1 Location mat (65×67 cm) - for the map tiles, tokens, monster figure, and cards,
1 Story mat (23×65 cm) - for the chapter board, events, and items.


Each mat is made of polyester on the 2 mm thick rubber by PlayMats.EU from Poland. This material is flexible, keeps its shape, and can be rolled easily for storage.

Game mats are designed to be modular, allowing you to use only the pieces you need. If you use all the mats, they will neatly create a perfect 130×85 cm rectangle (approx. 5×3 feet), with the Location and Story Mats centered on one side and the Player Mats placed around them.

Total weight 1.47 kg
Dimensions accurate to within 0.5 to 1 cm because of the stretchy nature of the mats.

boardgame.name: Machina Arcana: Core Dice
boardgame.description:
The Dice Vial contains a complete extra set of dice for Machina Arcana.


3x Black attack dice D6s,
3x White attack dice D6s,
1x Game die D10,
1x Recharge die D6.


Just as they are in the game, these dice are fully engraved and are therefore interchangeable. They're perfect for spares or to provide players with their own dice pool.

boardgame.name: UNO: Finding Dory
boardgame.description:
The search for excitement is over with the Finding Dory edition of UNO! Play the Just Keep Swimming Card to keep the action moving! Use the Customizable Cards to create your own memorable rules! And don't Forget to yell "UNO!" before you play your last card!

—description from the back of the box

Details about the two unique/new items in this version:

Just Keep Swimming Card – acts as a wild where the next person in order has to keep drawing until they pick a blue card.
Blank Cards – allow you to create house rule cards.


Both card types are worth 50 points if they are in your hand at the end of the round.

boardgame.name: UNO: Iron Man 2
boardgame.description:
Plays like standard Uno with red, green, blue, and yellow cards (25 each color) numbered 0-9, with skip, draw, reverse, wild and wild draw four cards. In addition, there are four additional "War Machine" cards for a total of 112 cards for this version. War Machine cards count 50 points in scoring and make you impervious to the effects of draw 2 and draw 4 cards by making your opponent draw those cards.

The Iron Man 2 version of Uno is listed in the main Uno Wikipedia page under "Theme packs". The Iron Man character is prominent on the bulk of the cards, with other characters from the movie used on the skip, draw, reverse, etc... cards.

boardgame.name: UNO: Simpsons Edition
boardgame.description: This version of UNO features Simpsons images on the cards, a new card type (Blinky Card) and it is housed in a box shaped like Homer's head.

boardgame.name: Block Ness
بلوك نيس
boardgame.description:
The Block Ness monsters are finally sticking their heads out of the water...but it looks like the lake isn't big enough for everyone!

In Block Ness, players take turns choosing a monster segment from their reserve and using it to increase the length of their creature on the Loch game board. Each new segment must be placed next to your monster's head or tail — with the head or tail piece then moving to the far side of the newly-placed piece — and you can cross the path of other monsters on the board only if you can go above them.

Once all players are blocked or everyone has placed all of their segments (with the size of the game board changing depending on the number of players), whoever has the fewest segments remaining in their reserve wins. In case of a tie, the tied player whose monster head has the highest elevation wins.

boardgame.name: Tramwer
boardgame.description:
Tramwer is a “game of routes” around the two lines of the Montpellier tramway.

After having drawn a route card, designating the starting point and the destination station to be reached, you must be the first to reach the destination.
There are many pitfalls in the smooth running of the game, such as the “strike days” boxes

It contains: a board, cards, pawns and a dice.

boardgame.name: Arkham Horror: Das Kartenspiel – In den Mahlstrom hinein: Mythos Pack
Arkham Horror: El Juego de Cartas – Hacia el Remolino: Pack de Mitos
Arkham Horror: Il Gioco di Carte – Nel Maelstrom: Pack Mito
Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Into the Maelstrom: Mythos Pack
Horreur à Arkham: Le Jeu de Cartes – Dans le Maelström
Horror w Arkham: Gra Karciana – W głąb wiru: Zestaw Mitów
boardgame.description:
Into the Maelstrom is the sixth Mythos Pack in The Innsmouth Conspiracy cycle.

Throughout your Innsmouth investigations, you have ventured into tide-hollowed caves and dripping tunnels - but these watery caverns are only the antechamber of the Deep Ones' domain. A hidden city rests beneath the choppy waves of the North Atlantic, slumbering at the bottom of the ocean. If you're going to protect the world from suffering the same fate as Innsmouth, you'll need to venture into the heart of the storm.

Within this Mythos Pack, you'll find the final scenario of The Innsmouth Conspiracy cycle, inviting you and your fellow investigators to dive into the darkness beneath the waves and confront the Deep Ones in their own city - putting an end to this threat forever. Combined with the addition of new player cards to upgrade your decks, Into the Maelstrom is a perfect capstone for a cycle of danger and mystery.

boardgame.name: Senet e Tablan
boardgame.description: Tablan + Senat - two games in one box.

boardgame.name: A Witch's Desire (OSE)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Debt Comes Due

Will it cost you everything?

Your hamlet has somehow survived the unnatural winter. It is a boon against all the tragedy in the world, and you live in relative comfort. But is the price too high? The Witch of the Wilds once again calls on you to complete a task. What does she want this time? Is it a bauble? Is it a dangerous trek? Soon you will find the truth and either perish at her whim or earn great favor and reward.

A Witch's Desire is an adventure for Old-School Essentials and compatible with any B/X game. A Witch's Desire can be a challenging adventure full of travel and exploration that should take anywhere between 8-12 hours to complete. Inside you will find 26 pages of dark fantasy content, including:

A modular dark fantasy adventure that can be set in whatever setting you desire.
New travel mechanics
A fully detailed map in GM and player formats

boardgame.name: Dark Roads
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It’s 272 of the Common Era, and the Emperor Aurelian has defeated King Cannabas and his Goths, but has abandoned Dacia. Now he marches on Palmyra. As his force crosses Anatolia, Aurelian calls his trusted retainers to him, and assigns to them a secret mission: contacting an imperial agent in Ankyra, an agent who may have access to Queen Zenobia herself.

Deep in enemy territory, the retainers learn that the agent has disappeared. Captured, killed, hiding—the retainers don’t know. All they know is that the clock is counting down, their emperor is relying on them, and the forces of the Palmyrene Empire may be hunting them.

Because facing down a Gothic Army wasn’t exciting enough.

This adventure for Centurion: Legionaries of Rome includes six pre-generated characters and usually runs between eight and twelve hours of play time.

boardgame.name: Jetzt schlägt's 13
boardgame.description:
The super fun game to freak out.
The electronic pinball action game is brought to the board as a clever dice game. Whoever manages to collect 88 points first in this crazy game has won. Everyone pushes his disc into the action area and collects points. And can also score points if he plays against the group in the subsequent action game and wins.

boardgame.name: Heja Sverige
boardgame.description:
Heja Sverige is a strategic level 2-player wargame set in the latter half of the 30 Years War when Sweden re-ignited the war in Germany.

Then France got involved as well and it would take 18 more years for the hostilities to end, leaving a shattered Germany in its wake when the war finally ended in 1648.

One player is the Union Player and he'll control the Factions of Sweden, France and the Protestants.

The other player is the League Player and he'll control the Factions of Spain, Bavaria and the Holy Roman Empire (HRE)

The game is played for a maximum of 9 two-year turns on a map divided into Areas controlled by the various Factions and Neutrals.

Armies consisting of Infantry, Cavalry and Artillery combat units are moved around by Generals, engage in combat and take control of Areas looking to fulfil their objectives.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Cosmic Lorry
boardgame.description:
In Cosmic Lorry you are cosmic merchants who are trying to build a big commercial network. You establish trade routes by connecting different planets. The more trade routes you create and the further apart the connected planets are, the more points you will score. The player who connects the planets most skilfully wins the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rungholt
boardgame.description:
Rungholt, the legendary Atlantis of the North Sea, was an island with a commercial town on the North Frisian coast, which was destroyed by a storm surge in the 14th century. In this game, you try to save the island and its residents from flooding. The water masses will engross the island relentlessly – are you able to secure the town, its residents and resources to make the most points from it? Use the dice wisely and leave the island as the heroic winner!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Lantris: Königliche Landschaften
boardgame.description:
In Lantris, you are a candidate for the coveted position of royal landscape architect and have the honorable task of designing the kingdom according to the wishes of your liege lord and thus help him to new glory. With your landscape cards, you build lands that please the King and earn you the most victory points. Whoever has gained the most points in the end is the new royal landscape architect of Lantris.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Chai (Deluxe Edition)
Чай
boardgame.description:
In Chai, you will step into the shoes of a tea merchant, combining tea flavours to make a perfect blend. Specializing in either rooibos, green, oolong, black or white tea, you will buy and collect ingredients to fulfill your customers’ orders.

As a tea merchant, each turn you will do one of the following: Visit the Market, Select Additives, Reserve a Customer.

At the end of each turn, a player may complete a tea order from one customer card in their hand or visible in the customer pool. A base tea token, tea flavours and additives shown on the card are needed ingredients, and placed in an empty tea cup. The player flips over a tip and receives a coin bonus, moving the thermometer round tracker up one notch if all cups are filled.

The game ends when five rounds of cups have been fulfilled. When the final order is completed, other players complete their last turn so that each player has played the same number of turns.
To score, players add up their victory points from fulfilled customer orders, and add their leftover money to this total. In 3-5 player games, additional points are awarded to the player(s) who fulfilled the most orders and most diverse tea recipes. Award ties are friendly with each winner receiving 5 points.

The player with the most victory points (from customer orders, money, and awards) wins the game as best tea merchant! In the case of a tie, the person with the least number of fulfilled customer cards wins. If still tied, the person with the least amount of money wins. If that does not break a tie, the victory is shared.

Unique features to the deluxe include:


10 deluxe exclusive cards
5 deluxe superfan-inspired cards
5 wild tea ingredient tiles
3 unique customer tips
3 NEW ability cards

boardgame.name: PixPlain
boardgame.description:
In PixPlain, you invent creative stories about why your picture card, which is actually not suitable, goes particularly well with the word on display. For example, describe what a snail has to do with speed and why a lemon is cute. Select one of your picture cards that does not match the word at all, with which you want to challenge the other players. The selected cards are shuffled and dealt again. Now you have 30 seconds to argue why your assigned picture card does match the word. Vote on which story you liked best. The winner keeps his card. The first person to have 3 cards wins the game.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Mazecraft: Finde den Weg
boardgame.description:
You have found the entrance to a dungeon maze, but unfortunately you don't have a map. You know that you have to find the sword and defeat the dragon to get to its treasure. But be careful, your fellow player is trying to do the same in your dungeon. Play with the pre-build dungeons or build your own. Decide in which direction you want to go on your map, if you go the wrong way or step into a trap, it's your opponent's turn. Whoever finds the sword and the dragon first wins the game.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Teelepathie: Das abgebrühte Teamspiel
boardgame.description:
You invite your friends for tea Time and want to enjoy an intimate conversation – while the other guests at the table are listening unintentionally. How do you manage to transmit the secret word without revealing yourself and the word category? Tealepathy is a word and association game. Choose a secret category with your changing team partner. Now it's up to you to convey a secret word within this category to him or her by giving clues. But be careful, the other players will try to find out which category it is. Depending on the vote of the audience, points are distributed to all players. Whoever has the most points after a round wins Tealepathy.

-description from publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Mechanism: Give a Clue / Get a Clue

boardgame.name: Mind Map AI
boardgame.description:
The INC Corporation has developed an artificial intelligence that  is indistinguishable from the humanoid. An international hacker  organization called HaXs 4 has hacked into the corporate network, aiming to destroy the AI. As the firewall of the INC Co. you are trying to create an impenetrable network over the coding so that the HaXs 4 have no chance to realize their plans. You have to work as a team to create a big firewall network. But everyone works on their own and just share little information. Roll the dice and establish fragments into your own Mind Map to build connections between the scripts to safe the coding of the AI. Every valid connection will score points to your team. The HaXs 4 get points by deleting connections. You win the game if you have more points as the HaXs at the end.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Vault Wars: Relic Roadshow
boardgame.description:
Legends speak of ancient relics, locked away for untold centuries -- who knows what treasures and terrors await? Great power can be yours if you’ve got a villainous eye for looking past the other temptations of the vaults!

Relic Roadshow adds new temptations to Vault Wars allowing you to bid your way to the dark side! New Vaults are uncompromised by special rules and instead award the second-highest bidder with powerful Relics to craft! Drawn by the corrupting power, Aspiring Villains reward you for crafting their desired Relics. Vices give powerful, unique abilities... if you’re willing to take on a bit of corruption, of course! Step right up and place your bid!

Players will take turns as an Auction Master, leading a cut-throat bidding war to selling off Vaults full of items to the other players.
Each Vault provides a unique experience, introducing new ways for the players to bid.
No player quite knows everything that's in a Vault, and there's lots of junk to fool your opponents into bidding on.
Between auctions, players may sell off their items to gain Gold, or save them for Victory Points -- paying storage fees to keep them around.
Collect gems for massive Victory Points, Weapons to gain lots of Gold, or rare Artifacts to gain powerful abilities.
Each player has up-and-coming heroes who are looking for specific items, giving out bonus victory points (but try to keep that a secret from your opponents).
The player with the most victory points after all the auctions will be the winner!

listing.notes: Title: Vault Wars: Relic Roadshow Publisher: Floodgate Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Feralis: Obscure Land
boardgame.description:
Feralis is a dark and brutal plane of existence, populated by numerous tribal races and civilizations in continuous tension between them, under the influence of mysterious and feared archaic deities the Aesyr. The card game Feralis calls the player to impersonate one of these cryptic and extraordinary gods. The Aesyr can make arrangements or dominate creatures that inhabit Feralis and force them into battle against other gods. Power, glory, boredom, it is not clear why these eternal gods continue to confront and murder each other, but no one has the memory of a time when the world of Feralis was not accompanied by the incessant rhythm of the colossal armies they summoned.

Feralis is a deck construction card game for battles 1vs1, 2vs2 and solo. The ultimate goal is to kill your opponents, to do so you have to recall your creaturs, mutate them, and use them to slay the creatures that stand in the opponent's area or go directly to the head of their leader.

In Feralis, the players have a deck of creatures, a Aesyr that impersonates, and a series of Godlike Skills assigned to the god. The creature cards have 2 sides, a "Call" side and an "Awakening" one. To put them on the battlefield you have to wait for their waiting cost in turns. Once your creatures on the "Call" side are defeated they will come back in the "Awakening" form. You can also play them directly in the "Awakening" form but you will miss the opportunity to see their "Call" form.

Your main resource is time, you have to put the creature at the right moment to create a powerful combo between your creature. You can reduce the time cost with a limited resource the Catalyst. You have a short amount that you can use also during your opponent's turn to unlock your creature in the Incubator area. You can support your creatures with your Godlike skills, powerful events that need time to be ready but they can turn the tide of battle. This Skills will recharge once used. Use all these resources wisely and have no mercy, your opponents will not.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Paleovet
boardgame.description:
We’ve brought dinosaurs back to life, but who will care for these magnificent and dangerous beasts?

You are paleo-veterinarians, competing to save as many dinos as possible from modern illnesses and injuries. Roll dice, upgrade your hospital, and compete with fellow paleo-veterinarians to treat injured and sick dinosaurs. As long as the dinosaurs don’t wake up during treatment, nothing can go wrong…

In Paleovet, players take turns drafting dinosaur cards from a central river, rolling dice, and spending dice icons for various effects, most notably curing sick and injured dinosaurs. Each dinosaur card lists which icons are needed to cure it, and effect, victory points, its genetic order, and diet.
Dinosaur effects can occur when the dinosaur appears in the center of the table when it is added to your hospital, or while it remains in your hospital. These effects can change gameplay in a variety of ways.

On your turn, you’ll follow a series of steps:

1. Remove a sleep token from each dinosaur in your hospital.
2. If you have fewer than four dinosaur cards in your hospital, select a dinosaur card from the five cards showing in the center of the table. Move it into your hospital.
3. Roll your dice. You begin with three basic dice and can purchase specialty dice later. The dice faces show the three treatments needed to cure dinosaurs, a tranquilizer dart, and a wild icon.
4. You may now spend dice and wild tokens to:
a. Cure dinosaurs by matching the treatment icons on the dice to the treatments listed on the dinosaur card. Each dinosaur requires between 1 and 5 treatments to complete
b. Buy additional dice by spending three matching dice icons
c. Buy a one-use wild token by spending two matching dice icons
d. Buy an upgrade card that provides a permanent beneficial effect by spending two matching icons
e. Spend a tranquilizer dart icon to move an additional dinosaur into your hospital (if you have less than 4 in your hospital already)
5. Any dinosaurs that are not cured and have no sleep tokens on them at the end of your turn wake. When this happens, discard the dinosaur card. If it was a carnivore, you must also discard another dinosaur card in your hospital (if you have any).
6. Any dinosaurs that were cured during your turn are moved into a victory pile. You’ve now scored the points listed on that dinosaur card.

Play continues until one of the card piles in the center of the table is empty. The round is completed, then all players total the points on their cured dinosaurs. The player with the highest score wins.

-description from designer
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep.99 PaleoVet, Dice Games, and Favorite Dinosaurs

boardgame.name: Legendary Hunters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Hunt is On!

Legendary Hunters is the latest volume in our series of class-focused player supplements for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, this time focused on the intertwined souls who use their connection to overcome challenges and hunt down threats, the hunter and their companion. These two use their skills in the wilderness, tandem tactics and training, and primal magic to protect their domains. Legendary Hunters completely redesigns the hunter class granting it more unique, diverse and iconic class abilities centered around their animal companion. The Legendary Hunter and their companion will stand up to any challenge and be a great addition to any adventuring party. Along with the redesigned base class are five new archetypes like the Outer Hunter with their arcane magic and evolved companion or the Phantasmal Hunter with a connection to beasts both alive and dead, 2 archetypes compatible with Spheres of Might and Spheres of Power, and 6 redesigned and updated archetypes from the original hunter like the urbane Courtly Hunter and the Packmaster with their coterie of companions. Hunters, rangers, and druids, both legendary and core, can benefit from new feats, for them and their companions, new companion options, and new spells that set magical traps, herbal spells and spells infused into ammunition. Finally, there is a sample character and their companion to show off the capabilities and features the class has to offer.

boardgame.name: Lords of Entropy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The PCs are headed towards the capital city but will have to get through Lagerfield first. On the road, they meet a merchant who warns them about a sect of evildoers that have taken over the region. Time to deal with a problem!

Although set in the Pangia Campaign, this adventure setting is easily adaptable to most any game and system.

boardgame.name: Warlock Patron: The Magpie
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

While most spirits shy away from the noise of cities and towns, the Magpie revels in their splendor - so many things for the taking! The Magpie is a spirit whose goal is to collect the truly shiniest of things to add to its collection. It almost solely judges its collection on each item's luster - the Magpie could collect something precious, like a sparkling gemstone, or trash, such as a loose scrap of metal which catches the light, and value both equally.

Opportunistic warlocks may make pacts with The Magpie aiming to collect things which would otherwise go unappreciated by their patron, or simply find satisfaction in delivering interesting baubles to the generally benevolent spirit. Whatever the case, the Magpie seems to have little interest in the motivations of its warlocks, so long as they remember to whom the shiniest prizes belong.

Building off of the existing Fifth Edition rules to build a warlock character, the Magpie grants warlocks unique abilities revolving around collecting cheap trinkets and baubles.

boardgame.name: Sk'uk'uruk
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In its area of space, the interstellar government has found evidence of at least one society that rose and vanished into the mists of history long before humanity established its current reign. These Precursors were highly advanced; one of their projects involved taking raw animal stock and uplifting it to sapience. One of these races, the Sk’uk’uruk, was derived from suid (pigs and boars) stock transplanted from Terra. As with anything else the precursors did, their reasons for doing so remain a mystery.

Sk’uk’uruk are highly individualistic and competitive, wary of strangers (especially offworlders) and conservative with an almost overpowering desire for order. They speak bluntly to the point of rudeness, and are driven to improve themselves. They can also be quite stubborn, harboring a belief that once an action is initiated, it must be seen through to the end. They engage in violence only with good reason, but can be dangerous if that reason is sufficient to provoke them.

Lifeform Reading: Sk’uk’uruk is for 2D6 science fiction games such as Cepheus Engine and The Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game, although it’s usable with other systems with a little work.

boardgame.name: Castle of the Mad Archmage Adventure Book (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The legendary megadungeon is here at last for Fifth Edition!

More than thirteen levels and over 1,500 keyed encounters of perils, monsters, traps, and treasure to bedevil your players. Find levels of warring humanoids, the deadly Arena, ancient artifacts, lost temples, portals to other worlds, and the ultimate secret of the dungeons... the Mad Archmage himself.

Originally released as a free electronic book in serial format, the Castle of the Mad Archmage has been completely revised, expanded, and updated. It is a complete adventuring environment, from the surface ruins to the deepest caves and caverns.

You and your players could literally spend years exploring the dungeons beneath the Castle and still not discover everything. It can accomodate characters from first to fifteenth experience level and beyond.

boardgame.name: Martial Drawbacks
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes it is not what you can do, but what you CANNOT do, that makes your character interesting.

With martial drawbacks, you can customize your martial spheres, gaining bonus talents and interesting hinderences to make your character more closely resemble what you want. With over 25 different martial drawbacks, there's something for everyone.

Made for Pathfinder 1st edition and the Spheres of Might system.

boardgame.name: Martial Racial Traits
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Alternative Racial Traits are a great way to customize your character's ancestry and culture, and with Martial Racial Traits, you can not only customize your character, but better integrate them with the Spheres of Might system.

Are you a gnome who's hobbyist concoctions give you a leg up on alchemy? Or perhaps an Ifrit whose burning blood and martial prowess manifest in great fiery weapons? Whatever your next character, find 15 alternative racial traits to help you make the most of them.

For Pathfinder 1st edition and the Spheres of Might systems.

boardgame.name: Monster Traditions
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Players aren't the only ones who can enjoy amazing abilities. With Monster Traditions, any creature can make use of the Spheres of Might system, gaining all manner of unique fighting styles to make them a force to be reckoned with.

In this apocrypha, gain a few new player talents, but also new monster talents, monster drawbacks, monster feats, and monster traditions to make any encounter a terrifying new experience.

For Pathfinder 1st edition and the Spheres of Might systems.

boardgame.name: Beastfolk Race Variants
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Even among creatures with similar ancestry, variations arise. Within these pages, you will find all manner of variations for catfolk, ratfolk, lizardfolk, and more, giving you new ways to customize your character's culture and ancestry to fit your games.

While most apocryphas contain only a page or two of content, this mammoth comes in at a whopping 5 pages of content, giving you all sorts of new options, whether you want to play a basili lizardfolk who can run on water, a small-paw catfolk who tumbles over it's larger prey, or a dayhunting strix with mastery of light magic, within these pages you'll certainly find something wonderful for your next beastfolk adventures.

Made for Pathfinder 1st edition and the Spheres of Power/Spheres of Might systems. Go beyond with Spheres Apocrypha!

boardgame.name: Collector
Spheres Apocrypha: The Collector Armorist
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The collector archetype is an armorist who doesn't just love equipment, they hoard it not unlike a dragon. And with the aid of their magic, it becomes obvious their equipment loves them back and will do whatever it can to defend them.

With the collector, claim your prizes, as many as you can carry, and launch them at your foes, using your special storage to claim them and call them to your side.

For Pathfinder 1st edition and the Spheres of Power systems.

boardgame.name: Neo-Morphosis: Infestation – Nyx Expansion
boardgame.description:
An optional Kickstarter exclusive crossover character from the Middara board game which comes with the following that can be used with Neo-Morphosis Infestation:

1 detailed plastic Nyx miniature
1 ID card
3 x Ability cards

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Kingdoms: The Zine of Generational Proportions
boardgame.description:
(from the back cover)

Kingdoms is a dark RPG set to the dawn of civilization, with the birth of man in an untamed sunless world.

You will lead your civilization, birth heirs, fight back the terrible monstrosities, and as generations pass, eventually, form nations.

Assemble your lineage's very own beast hunting weapon, dawn your gear, and prepare to fight the dark.
boardgame.rpg: Kingdoms: The Zine of Generational Proportions

boardgame.name: Anachrony: Infinity Upgrade Pack Box
boardgame.description:
Anachrony is a worker placement and tableau building game set in a foreboding future. As a leader of one of humanity's four ideological Paths, your goal is to prepare for an asteroid impact bound to happen over the course of the game, and become the dominant power on New Earth once the dust has settled. At your disposal are not only your loyal workers and high-tech Exosuits, but also the ability to open Time Rifts, implemented as an innovative game mechanism.

The Anachrony: Infinity Upgrade Pack Box includes every expansion and module released for the Anachrony: Fractures of Time KS and all stretch goals. This includes an exclusive box with plastic trays to hold all content provided and all previous content.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: Open box

This is the Kickstarter Infinity Upgrade Pack+ (w/ Exosuit commander pack addon contents inside), still new in the box. It includes the new Fractures of Time expansion in a large, uniquely numbered box, a plastic tray system to hold all current and previous content, an art and storybook, a set of printed plastic Warp tiles, and all unlocked stretch goals.
NOTE: This is the Upgrade Pack+, this does not include the base game.
INCLUDES: Anachrony: Fractures of Time Expansion LaserOx Modular Tray System 55 high-quality Printed Plastic Warp Tiles Art and Storybook
All stretch goals including: 3x Life Support Building Tiles 3x Lab Building Tiles 3x Factory Building Tiles 3x Power Plant Building Tiles 8x Upgrade Cards 4x Superproject Tiles 8x Leader Cards with reworked character art Path-specific art and asymmetric B sides for the Fracture Device mini boards 4x Fractures of Time Starting Asset Cards 10x Additional Water Drops 3x Collapsing Capital Tiles 13x Solo Endgame Condition Cards New Solo Variant with Expansion compatibility New Theme Art for Solo Variant: Chronossus Unique Numbering on Box Metallic Paint on Box 8x Resin Time Travel and Morale Tokens 12x Plastic Paradox Tokens Variable Anomalies Module Future Imperfect Module (Including the Quantum Loops, Hypersync Future Actions and the Intrigues of the Council Modules)
Buyer pays for shipping, I'll find best rate I can - just ask for quote.

boardgame.name: Alone in the Fantasy Settlement
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Alone in the Fantasy Settlement is a hack of Takuma Okada's Alone Among the Stars.

This is a journalling game requiring one player, a pack of 52 standard playing cards and a six-sided die (1d6) or another suitable randomiser.

You are a solo explorer of fantasy mountains, travelling through the uplands, encountering creatures and inhabitants, hazards, treasures and ruins of the world's mountainous regions. Perhaps you will find treasure; perhaps you will end your days crumpled at the bottom of a cliff.

See the video preview for a look at the full supplement.

boardgame.name: Spinning Fate: Heroic Boons and Banes
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Is inspiration starting to feel…a little uninspired?

Spinning Fate: Heroic Boons and Banes presents a rewarding alternative to simple inspiration to shake up your games. With hundreds of situational boosts (and hindrances) for players, Spinning Fate can take your reward game to epic levels!

What fate awaits? Consult the oracle and find out!

boardgame.name: Hibachi: Hot & Spicy
boardgame.description:
The Hot & Spicy expansion adds components for a 5th player, special player boards that give each player a special ability (and a place to store their chips, etc.), as well as some new spicy recipes that require chili! Make your dishes extra tasty, or try to cook one of the new recipes that require a sprinkling of spice!

The new Hot & Spicy recipe cards may be used instead of, or, shuffled in with, the recipe cards from the base game. Now chili is a required ingredient on the recipe cards! These recipes are earned the same way as regular recipes, but players now must spend 4 ingredient cards to learn them (3 ingredients, plus chili)

Components:
18 extra Ingredient cards
2 extra Chili cards
12 extra paper Yen
18 Hot & Spicy Recipe cards
7 yellow throwing chips
5 special chef mats
1 pair of chopstick

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Title: Hibachi: Hot & Spicy Publisher: Grail Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: D-D 1944
boardgame.description:
D-D 1944 is a game in which we must disembark the allied troops on the beaches of Normandy, the primary objective is to destroy the enemy turrets and strategically advance the troops so that they have range to shoot.
During the game we can play a series of missions to try to achieve a goal.
A game that simulates a small cooperative WarGame.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Das Festung Baues Spiel
boardgame.description:
Das Festung Baues Spiel, an early 18th century military fortifications board game, comprises 52 engraved playing cards numbered sequentially. The cards use the French suits — with the suit being an image of a fortification, many rather intricate and some quite attractive — along with a paragraph of explanatory text. Along the top of the sheet additional panels list the game's rules, and a panel along the left edge contains an index of important terms. A central panel bear the "Peter Schencken" imprint against an architectural backdrop adorned with military hardware.

The sheet could be dissected for use as a traditional deck of cards or left intact for use as a board game, using the rules printed at the top. These rules appear to be fairly straightforward, involving the rolling of dice to determine one's moves, the victor being the first to land on panel number 53, the Complete Vestung ("Complete Fortification"). Additional rules add spice to the game; for example, anyone landing on panel number 16 — the Aussenwercke ("Outworks") — must sit out two turns. By progressing through all the panels, players are exposed in sequence to the various elements of fortification, from basic geometry through the digging of counter approaches.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Collection #4, Crypt of Darkness
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Quick Crawls Maps - Dungeon Collection #4 is a brand new package from the Quick Crawls line, offering a set of five unique dungeon floor plans for a variety of uses! This package is especially made with the creative DM or publisher in need of generic maps in mind; each map represents a varied level of a dark crypt, including graveyard entrances, allowing the maps to be dropped into nearly any fantasy campaign imaginable!

With several maps, many tunnels and passages, and a creative team of foes, a single Quick Crawls Map can easily provide a full evening of adventure, exploration, and more!

boardgame.name: Aussie Games
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A set of 6 games with an Australian theme as a sort of parody of California Games. It was released in the US, but never seems to have been released in Australia.

The games are:

Bellywhack - attempting to make the biggest splash in Sydney Harbour by diving into it stomach first
Football - kicking the ball and then marking (catching) it
Boomerang throwing
Beer shooting - shoot empty beer cans from the back of a moving truck
Dry river boat race
Fishing

boardgame.name: Ghost Ops: Mission File 4 - Movie Ripoff
Ghost Ops: Mission Pack 4 - Movie Ripoff
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This mission pack contains five missions for use with the Ghost Ops - Modern Covert Operations RPG.

Mourning Star by Tim Loya
Operation Primrose Redux by Bradley Clark
X Marks the Spot by J A Cummings
The Assault by Ian F. White
Predator Pray by August Hahn

All the missions in this pack are rip-offs of famous movies, so if you ever wanted to put your players into movie situations and see what they would do, now is your chance.
boardgame.rpg: Ghost Ops: A Modern Day Covert Operations RPG

boardgame.name: Endangered: Screen Printed Tigers
boardgame.description: A set of 15 screen printed tiger meeples to replace the non-printed ones from the base game.

boardgame.name: Wissen & Quizzen: Faszinierende Pferde
boardgame.description:
A tiptoi quiz game about horses.

The four assistants "Käpt'n Quizzo" (KQ), "Jonny Joker" (JJ), „Wilma Weg“ (WW), and "Robert Ross" (RR) guide through the game with two difficulty settings.

Knowledge: Learn about horses as depicted on 26 different cards.

Trivia game: Players answer KQs questions and score victory points. KQ announces the winner at the end of the game.

Electronic: You need an electronic Tiptoi pen for the game.

boardgame.name: Nitro+ Royal -Heroines Duel-
Nitroplus Royal -Heroines Duel-
boardgame.description:
All Nitroplus heroines from "Phantom" to "Gekko no Carnevale" will appear!

A dream competition that transcends time and the world is realized here! Assassination, swordsmanship, magic, alchemy ... Use your own fighting style to reach the top !! You are the strongest nitro!

A 2D fighting mini-game sent by "Ogami Keiichi", a mini-game for Nitroplus!

All the voices of the heroines are newly recorded!
Don't miss the interaction that goes beyond their games!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Dice Baseball
boardgame.description:
Dice Baseball is a board game that can be easily learned and enjoyed by those who like baseball and those who do not know well.

Recommended for these people.

Those who do not know baseball but want to learn easily.
Those who are interested in baseball.
If you are looking for a highly portable game.


Dice Baseball, which is played by actual baseball rules, is not a simple lucky dice game, but melts the psychological elements of baseball to enhance immersion, and even those who do not know baseball rules and terms can easily learn and play with pictures and icons.

Game preparation

Team Selection: The person who visited the baseball field most recently selects the desired team.
Round decision: Decide how many innings to play.
First decision: The person who rolls the dice and gets a high number is decided.
Receive Cards: Each player receives 3 cards.


Game progress

Draw a card: The attacking team receives 2 attack cards and the defending team receives 2 defense cards.
Card play: Each player turns the card face down and turns it face up at the same time.
Confrontation: Check if the range of the attack card and the defense card match. If the range matches, the batter wins. If not, the pitcher wins. Roll 2 dice and apply the result.
Use of team cards: There are 2 team cards each with special ability (batter, pitcher). Use it when you need it during the game.


Game end
All innings are played, and the team with the highest score wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Apocrypha Adventure Card Game: Master's Edition Box
boardgame.description: A beautiful embossed deluxe wooden box with a hand-stained exterior and compartments for all the cards, dice, and pawns for all three boxes of Apocrypha. Comes with a rare book of fiction called The Book of Omens.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Apocrypha Adventure Card Game: Box One – The World
Apocrypha Adventure Card Game: Box Three – The Devil
Apocrypha Adventure Card Game: Box Two – The Flesh

boardgame.name: The Ninth World: A Skillbuilding Game for Numenera – The Beyond Pack
boardgame.description:
A set of 55 regions cards from beyond the Steadfast. This set features the regions in these kingdoms: The Black Riage, The Caecilian Jungle, The Plains of Kataru, Seshar, The Frozen South, The Cloudcrystal Skyfields, Lostrei the Spiritlands, Vralk the Red Kingdom, Corao, The Lands of the Dawn, and The Rayskel Cays. This set was made available only to Kickstarter backers.

-description from designer
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Ninth World: A Skillbuilding Game for Numenera

boardgame.name: Europa-Wettflug
boardgame.description:
The players start in Hamburg. Movement is determined by a die. The first player back in Hamburg wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.
On the game board, some cities are equipped with a hidden metal strip whereas the planes are outfitted with a magnet. If a plane lands at such a city the magnet aligns with the metal strip and the nose of the plane points in the direction of the detour, marked in green on the board.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Muumien hillojahti
boardgame.description:
A flicking game in the Moomin world for ages 4 and up. You try to collect fruits and berries in a jar for Moominmamma to make jam out of.

You flick a basket along the board and if it ends on a fruit field, you collect that fruit in your jar. After you have collected all 6 different fruits, you need to flick the basket inside the Moomin house at the end of the board to win. Watch out for Hattifatteners!

boardgame.name: Lockdown!: The Game
boardgame.description:
Lockdown!: The Game is a comedy game created by James Veitch during the 2020 COVID-19 pandemic in which players try to trade cards to collect sets and loo rolls before COVID-19 ends the game. The trading mechanisms are supported by a bluffing mechanism in which players can lie about the cards they are trading.

Each player starts with seven cards from the twelve types in the game. Each turn, a player draws two additional cards, then tries to negotiate trades, e.g., "I can trade Day drinking and Online, for company and distraction." After a successful deal, players trade the cards secretly. When trading, players can lie about the cards they are offering, except the first card that they offer. Players can additionally add Loo rolls as sweeteners for the trade. If a player collects three cards in the same category, they must play this set for points.

The game ends when six COVID-19 cards are drawn, then all played sets are scored. Black cards in your sets (good events) are worth 2 points, loo rolls are 1 point, and red cards and unplayed cards are 0 points.

boardgame.name: Krazy Maze
boardgame.description:
Krazy Maze was a 1940s board game published in Australia under licence by G. N. Raymond. National Archives Australia verifies the author being an Alan Joseph Howell and John Allan who registered the game in 1943

The game was a simple spin and move mechanism where two separate paths wind through a densely illustrated picturesque landscape. When two players play each takes a separate path. The game came with a spinner, called a "spino", which displayed numbers from 1 to 8. Players take turns spinning and moving their counter the corresponding number of squares.

Some squares on each track are marked with a letter of the alphabet and a player must follow an instruction that corresponds to that letter. For example, landing on the "A" square of the left track results in the instruction "Forgotten lunch. Back to start"; landing on the B square results in "Tiger snake on road. Extra spin to get past."

The two tracks diverge at square one and rejoin at square 89. Square 90 is the last square. A player must spin the exact number to land on square 90. The first player to do this wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Lese-Piraten
boardgame.description: On a lonely island, the pirates found the treasure of the famous pirate Lautikus. Unfortunately, the treasure is locked! In order to open it, the kids can solve some tricky vocabulary games.

boardgame.name: Piraten-ABC mini
boardgame.description: The famous pirate Lautikus is searching for a successor. But only the strongest pirates can win. Therefore, Lautikus invented 3 games where kids should be good in remembering, be very fast and knows what to do with words. The fastest and smartest kid wins.

boardgame.name: Pirate Arithmetics mini
Rechen-Piraten mini
boardgame.description: The pirates are looking for a treasure - a calculation treasures! Join in and find the two gold coins which will show the correct mathematical answer of addition, subtraction or multiplication. The arithmetic calculation disk shows, which anser is correct and which kid wins.

boardgame.name: Käpt'n Klabauter
boardgame.description:
On a little island, there is a huge gold treasure. Every pirate has some ducates in his boat and paddles to the island. But be careful - if a storm is coming or the captain appears, everything goes worse... The goal of the game is to be the first one on the island - with a little bit of tactics and some luck.

—description from the back of the box (translated)

boardgame.name: Hoppelhopp
boardgame.description: Who is faster? The bird Flips or the rabbits? Flips just learned to fly and therefore challenges the rabbits. The 5 rabbits of course need to help each other to be faster than Flips. The first one to be on the final tree wins.

boardgame.name: Bantam West
boardgame.description:
Welcome, weary traveler, to the town of Gallow Springs - the only "civilized" town on the entire Dethelm Frontier. Surrounded by bandits, predators, and cultists, only the toughest survive. If you’re going to last, you must find a source of income, purchase new gear, build shelter, recruit a posse, and protect your homestead. Do you have what it takes?

Bantam West is an ITS adventure game for 1-4 players set in the wild frontier. In this frontier sandbox, you must form a plan and play on your character's strengths, weaknesses, and personality to outperform the competition. Whether you live the life of a powerful merchant, an agile gunslinger, a malicious arsonist, or a stealthy thief, there is a unique way for you to come out on top! Along the way, be on the lookout for enemies and rival players who are aiming to fight you, burn your cabins down, and steal your hard-earned wealth!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Mafia's Night: Citizen Expansion
boardgame.description:
Citizen expansion adds 3 new citizen roles to help them cast out mafia members.
It also adds a small module, named "Representative".

boardgame.name: Mafia's Night: Contagious Expansion
boardgame.description:
A new expansion which adds a totally new independent party: Coronavirus!
This expansion adds 6 new (and some upgraded) roles and a wholly new faction with a unique win condition.

boardgame.name: Cold Cases
boardgame.description:
One of the participants plays William Wisting and sits on one side of the magnetic, vertical game board. It's your job to track down the perpetrators and bring them to justice. Every time you lead one criminal to the arrest, you must give a handcuff piece to that participant.

Other participants sit on the other side and act as criminals. When you committed your criminal acts, you left traces. Now each of you must return to the crimescene to destroy the tracks so that Wisting does not get hold of you. You start with five track cards each on hand, one track card of each color. Every time you manage to get to one of your crime scenes, you have to leave that track card to Wisting.

If you as William Wisting get rid of all your handcuffs cards first, you win. But if a criminal manages to get rid of all his track cards, he wins. Everyone plays against everyone. The criminals constantly see how Wisting moves, but Wisting does not know how the criminals move.

Wisting must be strategic and try to calculate how the criminals move on the game board.

The battle is between Wisting and the fastest criminal. Should evil or good win?

boardgame.name: Pass auf Pinguin!
boardgame.description:
It's spring and the ice begins to melt. The little penguins waddle from one ice floe to the other. Some floes melt too much so that the penguin has to jump into the water and start from the beginning again.
The player who manages to take all his penguins to the end of the ice floes wins.

boardgame.name: Ninety Minutes
boardgame.description:
A turn based football tactics game in which you control your team of players in combination with using custom formations, team tactics and your hand of highlight cards, to defeat your opponent before the end of ninety minutes.

This game is intended to replicate the excitement of match day in a turn based board game as you attempt to outscore your opponent. With numerous formations, tactics and highlight card abilities to choose from, you will need to ensure your tactics are up to the task, and hope that luck is on your side to achieve the required dice rolls to execute them effectively.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Mini RatzFatz: Buchstaben und Wörter
boardgame.description: The players draw cards with letters and tell a short story with as many words starting with this letter as possible. But caveat, the letter monster might come at every moment and catch some of the letters, before you can finish your story.

boardgame.name: Mini Ratzfatz: Zählen und Rechnen
boardgame.description: The cards with the images are put face up on the table. One player tells a story which contain some of the numbers or sets shown on the cards. The player who is the first one to recognize the number resp. set, gets the card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

boardgame.name: Mini RatzFatz: Erstes Englisch
boardgame.description: All cards are put face up on the table so that the players can see the images. One player reads an English story and the other players try to take as fast as possible the corresponding cards. A very nice game to learn a little bit of English!

boardgame.name: Corny Gron
boardgame.description:
Designer summary

Corny Gron (Dark Peak) adapts Pelle Nilsson's Mork Borg precursor Dark Fort, to the Polish Carpathians Mountains. With folklore's flavor, Podhale and Beskidy's highlanders and highwaymen, high mountain fey-kings and fiendish nobles living in out-of-this-world mountain manors.

boardgame.name: Exploit Zero: Hostile Takeover
boardgame.description:
Exploit Zero: HOSTILE TAKEOVER

Corporate War - Coming Soon to a Sprawl near you!

The latest Exploit Zero rule book, Hostile Takeover shifts the game away from cooperative or solo mode and lets players command their own security force in a head-to-head corporate war.

Now your elite Agents join small, multi-model tactical units: fire teams of troopers, pods of gun drones, individual specialists, and customized heavy support units. These combined forces will form the assault teams you deploy all across the urban sprawl as you plan, maneuver, and fight to take control of your rival’s corporate headquarters.

An easy to learn, fast play, open miniature table top war game for 15-28mm miniatures set in a gritty cyberpunk future.

boardgame.name: Mini RatzFatz: Sicher im Straßenverkehr
boardgame.description: The cards with the images are put face up on the table. One player tells a story about traffic rules, signs and lights which are visible on some of the cards. The player who is the first one to recognize the correct card and knows the rule, gets the card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

boardgame.name: UNO: WWE Card Game
boardgame.description:
UNO game with the WWE wrestling heroes from 2010.
The game is player with the normal rules except 1 special card the "Card Royal Rumble".
If 1 player plays this card like the color choice card, but each other player tries to play one card of this color as fast as possible. The player who is the fasters puts his card on the discard pile. The next player is the one left to the "Card Royal Rumble" player.

boardgame.name: Ancient Greek City States 5thc BC
boardgame.description:
The board game Ancient Greek City States is a turn based economic and war game, for 2 to 4 players, set during the 5thc B.C in southern Greece. The game includes 1 map of Southern Greece 32” x 36” at 8 miles to the inch, circa 5thc B.C., 1,680 economic chits, 1,960 military and control chits, 760 number counters, 3 player aids, Greek money and 4-6sided and 4-10 sided dice. Players can choose to play various city states providing the whole family with hours of entertainment, while learning a great deal about the actual history of the 5thc BC. See my website at www.bison-games.com

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The First Crusade 1096 to 1099
boardgame.description:
"The First Crusade: 1096 to 1099" is a turn based wargame, for 2 to 11 players, set during the 11the Century A.D. in the Levant area of the Middle East. The game includes 1 map of the Levant 36” x 48” at 24 miles to the inch, circa 11thc A.D., 1,540 military and control counters printed on both sides, player aids, medieval Bezants counters, 3-6 sided and 3-10 sided dice. Players can choose to play the Crusaders, Byzantines, Lesser Armenians, Seljuk Turks, Other Muslims and the Fatimids of Egypt. This wargame can provide the whole family with hours of entertainment, while learning a great deal about the actual history of the 11thc A. D..
See my website at www.bison-games.com

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Age of Iron & Steel 1870 to 1929
boardgame.description:
The board game The Rise of the Iron & Steel Industry of the United States and Canada is a turn based economic game set in the late 19thc and early 20thc in the eastern USA and southern Canada. The game includes 1 map of the eastern USA and Canada 36” x 48” at 28 miles to the inch, circa 1920’s A. D., 3,200 number counters to record your sites, 50 pages of commodity charts listed by state, multiple player aids and 4-10 sided dice. Players can choose to play various sectors of the Iron and Steel industry and their related finished products providing the whole family with hours of entertainment, while learning a great deal about the actual history of the Iron & Steel industry in the late 19thc and early 20thc United States and Canada. The price does not include shipping and handling. See my website at www.bison-games.com

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Gazelle Mini Ship Pack
boardgame.description:
The Gazelle Close Escort was originally designed as an anti-piracy and customs enforcement vessel, with hundreds still in service with the Imperial and Planetary navies. The ship is also popular with small mercenary and private security companies, prized for its robust construction and durability.

This mini ship pack includes 11 cards:

1x Gazelle Close Escort Ship Card

2x Red Team Adventure Card

2x Weapons Testing Adventure Card

3x Drop Capsules Upgrade Card

3x RVD Superdense Armor Upgrade Card

The Gazelle Close Escort mini ship deck is not a standalone product, additional cards are required to play Traveller.

The Traveller Customizable Card Game is a licensed adaptation of Marc Miller's classic science-fiction role-playing game of commerce, exploration and adventure in the Far Future.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Two Player Starter Set

boardgame.name: The Industrial Revolution in the Southern New England Area 1830 to 1889
boardgame.description:
The board game The Southern New England Manufacturing Game is a turn based economic game set in the 19thc Southern New England and Hudson Valley NY area. The game includes 1 map of the Southern New England 36” x 48” at 4.85 miles to the inch, circa 1880’s A. D., 3,040 number counters to record your sites, 172 pages of commodity charts listed by product, multiple player aids and 4-10 sided dice. Players can choose to play various industrial sectors providing the whole family with hours of entertainment, while learning a great deal about the actual history of each industry of the 19thc in Southern New England. The price of the game does not include shipping costs. See my website at www.bison-games.com

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Snack Time Game
boardgame.description:
It's snack time!

Launch squishy frogs through The Child's mouth-to the player on the other side. You both race to clear your side of all frogs and the first one to do so wins!

Don't take turns. You both launch squishy frogs at the same time!

Any frogs that arrive on your side must be sent back before you can win. So keep launching as fast as you can!

This is the way!

-description from the back of the box

boardgame.name: Star Trek: The Next Generation Collectible Dice Game – USS Enterprise NCC-1701-E Starter Set
boardgame.description:
Based on the Star Trek TNG First Contact movie. Five Rings Publishing Group released the game in a Federation and Borg starter pack.

This is the USS Enterprise NCC-1701-E Starter Set
This Federation set contains all one player needs to explore and defend Starfleet
25 assorted 20mm polyhedral dice; three 6-sided, five 8-sided, six 10-sided, seven 12-sided and four 20-sided dice
The dice control your ship's warp core, reserve power, shield strength, phasers, quantum torpedos, damage control, impulse power and sensors
A full-color ship Bridge/control panel from which you command ship systems and personnel
A full color ship shield and icon chart, and a 24 page Basic Training(TM) instruction book and rules.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Star Trek: The Next Generation Collectible Dice Game – USS Enterprise NCC-1701-E Booster Set #5
Star Trek: The Next Generation Collectible Dice Game

boardgame.name: Hold The Fort
boardgame.description:
Hold The Fort is a quick-fire strategy card game for 2 to 6 players where you are the commander of your fortress and your cards are your army of heroes.

Before the game starts, players are randomly dealt a Fortress Card and four to six Hero Cards. Players then choose two Hero Cards from their hand to defend their fortress with. These cards are placed face down in front of their fortress and the game begins. On a player’s turn, they take one of three actions; recruit, defend, or attack.

To recruit, a player picks a card from the draw pile. If they draw a Hero Card, it is added to their hand. If they draw a Chaos Card, the scenario described on the card takes effect.

To defend, a player takes a Hero Card from their hand and bolsters their defence by placing it next to their existing defenders.

To attack, a player takes up to three Hero Cards from their hand and lays siege to another player’s fortress. They roll the Dice of The Fates to see if their heroes receive a boon or a penalty. The total score of all attacking and defending cards is then calculated and it is determined whether the attack failed or succeeded.

On a failed attack, the defending player wins the Hero Cards that unsuccessfully attacked them. On a successful attack, the attacking player wins the defeated defending Hero Cards. The defending player then attempts to rebuild their defence with any Hero Cards from their hand.

When a player no longer has any Hero Cards to defend their fortress with, their Fortress is conquered and they are out of the game.

The last player left standing wins!

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Chocim. Potęga Husarii
boardgame.description:
"Chocim. Potęga Husarii" (Chocim. The might of the Hussars) is a wargame for 2 players, focusing on the epic battle of Chocim, fought in 1621 between the forces of the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth and of the Ottoman Empire.

The struggle lasting several weeks and consisting both of pitched battles, as well as of skirmishes and siege actions ended in a stalemate and to a truce. The besieged Polish-Lithuanian forces prevailed and managed to stop a further Ottoman expansion North.

One of the players will take control of the more numerous Ottoman forces and his objective will be to break through the Polish fortifications and take control of the main Polish encampment.

The player controlling the Commonwealth forces will be defending his fortress at all costs at the same time trying to bring down enemy morale to a level at which it will refuse to keep on fighting.

If neither side achieves their objective on the battlefield before the end of the 5th turn the game is decided upon a diplomatic clash when both players will use their diplomacy assets acquired throughout the game.
