boardgame.name: Is It Me? Is It You?
boardgame.description:
Is It Me? Is It You? is a social game for two players (best with BFFs or partners) to determine how much you have been paying attention to the other player's quirks.

Players take turns reading out one of 100 questions (example: "Which of us is more likely to lock themselves out of the house?"). Both players then simultaneously hold up their paddles--marked on opposite sides with "Me" and "You"--to indicate which of them they feel is the best answer to the question. Point are awarded accordingly.

boardgame.name: What The Plot?!
boardgame.description:
"A party game for people who like to talk sh*t."

Ever wanted to tell your friends how you lost your eyebrows or about the time you had dinner with aliens? Well, now is your chance!

Take a Prompt card. Take a Word card. You now have one minute to bullsh*t a story. After the minute is up, the player next to you has to continue your story and so on!

If a player doesn't use one of the three words on the Word card, fails to complete the challenge, can't bullsh*t a story (ex. says uhhhh a lot), or gets booed, they will have to keep the Word card or Boo card.

The first player to collect three cards is a terrible bullsh*tter and the story ends. The player who is not the worst wins!

boardgame.name: Malleus Monstrorum Deck
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

A range of monsters with game characteristics and evocative artwork.

Call of Cthulhu Keeper Decks are designed to provide in game resources, handy references, and information. Use the Malleus Monstrorum Deck when you need to reference a monster profile and when designing scenarios and encounters. These decks provide new layers to plots, enhance the story, and provide quick access to an array of fiendish foes. Other decks in the series include: The Curious Characters Deck, The Phobia Deck, The Unfortunate Events Deck, and The Weapons and Artifacts Deck.

boardgame.name: Ice Cream You Scream!
boardgame.description:
ICE CREAM YOU SCREAM! is a family game for all ages where you each own a competing ice cream shop. You roll 7 dice to dish out ice cream cones complete with whipped cream and a cherry on top. Players roll up to seven dice per turn trying to build their treat with a flavored cone, cherry, whipped cream, and 1-4 specific scoops to score points. As long as one die on your roll can build onto the cone you've started, you can keep rolling to complete it or risk your progress to add more scoops and freeze out your opponents. Push your luck too far and you'll end up with brain freeze and find your chances of victory dropping precipitously.
Once one player has sold cones of all four flavors, whoever has sold the most total scoops wins!

boardgame.name: Le jeu du Maine-et-Loire
boardgame.description:
Le Jeu du Maine-et-Loire is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Nearly 550 written questions and photos with also charades and riddles, "junior" questions which deal with subjects as varied as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the Maine-et-Loire, Angers, Saumur, Cholet...

Rules:
Each player places his pawn on his commune of residence or of his choice.
You will travel through the territory and have to answer questions on different themes. If the answer is correct you can replay.
To be the winner, you will have to collect 5 "Site" cards by going to their respective box and answering the question correctly.

boardgame.name: Le jeu du Grand Quercy
boardgame.description:
Le Jeu du Grand Quercy is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Nearly 550 written questions and photos with also charades and riddles, "junior" questions which deal with subjects as varied as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the Grand Quercy region.

Each player places his pawn on his commune of residence or of his choice.
You will travel through the territory and have to answer questions on different themes. If the answer is correct you can replay.
To be the winner, you will have to collect 5 "Site" cards by going to their respective box and answering the question correctly.

boardgame.name: Willow
boardgame.description:
Willow is a climbing game, in the style of Tichu, Tien Len, Haggis, Chimera, Fight the Landlord, The Great Dalmuti, and many others. If you’ve ever played trick-taking games like Spades or Hearts, climbing games are a little bit like that, but with poker hands instead of singles cards, and the tricks can go around the circle multiple times.

The big difference between Willow and other climbing games is that most combos stay on the table after they are played and can be
added to (like in German Rummy). This makes it a lot easier for more players to play in more Tricks.

boardgame.name: The Big Game: Explore Bhutan Wilderness
boardgame.description:
With The Big Game: Explore Bhutan Wilderness meet six different kinds of jungle cats, and more wild animals, all from Bhutan!
Asiatic Golden cat, Pallas cat,Fishing cat...even a Leopard cat!
And of course, Takin, Bhutans national animal.
All of them waiting for you to be discovered in this beautiful board game.

Bhutan is a paradise for wildlife lovers.
It has such a range of small and large animals, starting with the Raven and ending with the One-horned Rhino! It is a safari experience that you would want to come back to. And even plan a real one.

All of these and more are waiting for you to be discovered. They get you points and make you the winner.
Catch the glimpse of a Snow Leopard on the hunt and take 25 points!
Yes, and that Golden Cat is worth 20 points!
Keep adding up the points - it even helps your Math!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Happy New Year 1999
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The year is 1999, the millennium year looms on the horizon. Icicles crystalize on the lobby's stained glass windows while the Fall Bar is alive with the chattering of those warmed by coffee and liquor.

Welcome back to the Hotel, it has been waiting.

boardgame.name: Animal Buddy: Bhutan Wild Trail
boardgame.description:
An eye-catching, colourful game board for the tiny ones, designed for small spaces

Get your own safari jeep in bright yellow or blue,
55 game cards, including
45 wild animals waiting to be your buddies,
2 alert cards and
5 cards with game instructions



Bhutan has steep, rugged mountains and deep valleys in the North to sub-tropical forest and bamboo jungles in the South. 72% of Bhutan is dense, virgin forest. Find your buddies from those lovely wild animals who live there!

A simple game for the parent-at-home and the young one. Set out on a fun trek through the dense jungles and mountains of Bhutan!. On the way, you meet all sorts of animals.
They will tell you where to go next: they want you to meet their friends and also leave the forest unharmed.
Splash mud on any animal and it becomes your buddy on you jungle trail !
Make friends with more animals as you explore the jungle.
In every round, you find new buddies - and they find you too! Tell your friends who you met on your trek !!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Faust
Nebuchadnezzar
Nebuchadnezzar
boardgame.description:
Rules

Nebuchadnezzar is a game of annihilation for two players. Not only are draws impossible in Nebuchadnezzar, almost any game of Nebuchadnezzar played to its conclusion will end with a board completely filled with a single color of disc.

Materials: A square board of any size (nothing bigger than 15x15 is recommended due to the amount of recycling and potential number of moves along with the amount of mechanical flipping involved) and an unlimited supply of discs with each player's color on either side. Go stones can also be used if you're willing to replace them instead of flip discs. (note: If you have an Othello set, 8x8 is a fine size to get started with)

Objective: wipe your opponent completely off the board!

Gameplay: Starting with black, on his turn a player may place a disc with his color facing up on any empty cell. He may alternatively capture enemy discs according to only one of two conventions. He cannot place and capture on the same turn.

A)If a single disc is surrounded on 4 sides by enemy discs, at least one of which, is itself, mutually surrounded by 4 friendly discs on all of its sides, then a player may capture (flip) all 4 of these enemy discs.

B)A player may otherwise flip a rectangle of discs consisting purely of enemy discs, if the following qualifications are met


The rectangle is entirely bounded by single-colored walls (of discs) on all 4 of its sides
The player owns the majority of the perimeter created by these walls
The rectangle is not part of a bigger rectangle meeting these criteria.


Edge rule: If one or more of the walls bounding a rectangle are board edges these will take on the color of the parallel walls opposite to them. If a rectangle is bounded by two opposite board edges then these are considered to be neutral walls.

Forced passing: You automatically pass your turn if no legal move is available for you on your turn. Otherwise passing is not permitted

Pie: After the first move, the second player may choose to switch colors instead of playing a disc of his color for his first move.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: DELVE: A Solo Game of Digging Too Deep
boardgame.description:
DELVE: A Solo Game Of Digging Too Deep is a solo map drawing game that puts you in control of a dwarven hold as you discover the horrors that lurk below. This roughly 32 page A5 zine has everything you need to generate natural formations, forgotten ruins, enemies, wyrd magics, and ancient monstrosities. It has a simple turn-based combat system, rules for building your hold, and tips on how to implement your hold into your RPG world.

Inspired by games like Dwarf Fortress and Dungeon Keeper, DELVE aims to capture that feeling of building and protecting a fortress in an unforgiving subterranean world.

boardgame.name: I am Alias Junior
Jag är Junior ... Alias
Krakka segðu
boardgame.description:
In this children's game, the players together explain what a secret figure or thing a player is. You are not allowed to use the same word that is included in the word you are going to explain, so it is important to use your imagination. If you guess it correctly, you score a point but everyone can win points on each round. This first player to the blue dot in the center of the board wins.

The player in turn has no idea what the card in the headband shows - so you have to listen carefully and take help of the clues that your teammates give you. Maybe you're Robin Hood, a giraffe or even a pumpkin.

Components: 4 headbands, 200 cards, sand timer, game board, 4 pawns.

--description from publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Junior Versions of Grown-Up Games

boardgame.name: T34 Leader
boardgame.description:
In T34 Leader, you're in command of a Soviet armoured company of tanks, armored cars, trucks, and armoured infantry. You may also be assigned air support and heavy weapons support in order to achieve your goals. Your goals are to take your objectives while trying to keep as many of your men alive as possible during realistic tactical missions.

T34 Leader features various historical campaigns that can be played as individual campaigns or linked to form one huge mega-campaign that follows your troops from the Invasion of Poland to the final battles on the Eastern and Western fronts.

A major part of the game is mission planning. You decide which vehicles and infantry units to use and which commanders are best for the mission. Vehicle and infantry commanders are rated for skill level and even personality quirks such as how well they keep their heads while under fire. Deciding which commanders are used for each mission is a major consideration. Your units will become fatigued with every mission. If you push a commander and his men too hard, his skills will degrade. Your commanders and their crew also gain experience with every mission. This makes for some great decision-making. Should you keep fighting with your top commanders and crew and further fatigue them to get the job done, or let the new guys fight in order to prep them for the tough missions ahead?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Ultimate Drinking Game: Core Edition
boardgame.description:
72 cards combining new and classic drinking games with a nasty twist.

At the start of the game, players draw 5 cards and declare a "Captain" to settle any or all disputes.
Players can choose to play a card on themselves, allowing the card to be removed from or play it on another player, returning the card to the bottom of the draw deck, before drawing back up to 5 cards.
Once the draw deck is depleted, the player who discards all cards from their hand first is the winner.

boardgame.name: Kieszonkowce quizowe. Wiesz, że nic nie wiesz
boardgame.description: The game contains almost 500 questions about music, film and general knowledge.

boardgame.name: Ocean Slayers: The Bermuda Chronicles
boardgame.description:
In Ocean Slayers: The Bermuda Chronicles, you are a fierce pirate captain set out to discover the Fountain of Youth and unlock its' power to eternal life.

Explore the ocean, slay ancient monsters, gather epic items, battle opponents, expand your fleet & resource production and race your way to the Fountain of Youth.

Will you be the first captain to defeat the beast and win the game?

---

Players start the game at their base settlement with a limited shipping fleet and crew members. Each turn players can explore the map by turning tiles and expanding their territory.

Through building a steady stream of resources players become ever more powerful each round, allowing them to upgrade buildings and construct bigger and better ships.

You'll discover hidden treasures, resource islands, ancient temples, lighthouses, monster lores and the Bermuda Triangle itself in a dynamic landscape that will require a different strategy each time you play.

Explore the map to increase your terrain dominance and occupy strategic locations to fend of opponents. Settle on resource islands and upgrade your buildings to expand your resource production and power. Slay ancient monsters to receive gold and unique items that will grant you powerful abilities. Wage war against your opponents to loot their treasure pile, destroy their fleet or take over one of their resource islands.

Upon proving your worth as a mighty monster hunter you may enter the mythical Bermuda Triangle and seek out the Fountain of Youth. But beware before entering, because the Kraken will not be defeated easily.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Babacadabra
boardgame.description:
The witch Babacadabra needs your help to find all the ingredients necessary to make her spells.
Babacadabra is a game of skill, precision and concentration, for 2-5 players aged 6 and up: a game to stimulate collaboration between the players, sorcerer’s apprentices, while developing their observation and descriptive skills. A quick and fun game, to do anywhere in minutes!

How to play
Players must cooperate and collaborate with each other in order to get hold of all the ingredients necessary for witch Babacadabra’s spell.
Taking turns, each player plays the role of the witch Babacadabra and describes to her helpers the 9 ingredients listed on her “Enchantment” card.
The other players, who play the sorcerer’s apprentices, must find the 9 ingredients in the given amount of time by looking for them among the “Ingredient” cards scattered on the table.
But beware: finding the ingredients is not an easy task because the images depict very similar objects and can therefore be confused and mixed up.

boardgame.name: Hentai House
boardgame.description:
User Summary

After you just moved to the city to work, you move to a house with some beautiful girls: And your new life with them begins.

There are many scenes (dressed and undressed) as well as erotic scenes. The game also contains Match-3 games

boardgame.name: I Love Hamilton: Trivia Game
boardgame.description:
750 questions and answers about Hamilton, Ontario.

Contents:

1 gameboard
2 dice
150 tokens
6 score cards
6 pawns
1 Q&A book

boardgame.name: YUME
boardgame.description:
User Summary

During war time, a young woman enters an abandoned dance hall to record a program in peace. Here she starts to feel unwell and see another young woman - looking exactly like herself wearing a red dress... Who is this girl? Is it herself from the past?

boardgame.name: The Stump of Elemental Evil
boardgame.description:
A card-based expansion for Four against Darkness. Instead of rolling on tables to generate places and encounters, the player(s) draw cards from a deck and apply the results to the adventure.
The deck features a standalone adventure in which the heroes explore a cave hidden under a rotting stump, and attempt to sly the feared Tentacle Worm.

boardgame.name: Magnytour Profil: Tour du pays Basque
boardgame.description:
The Tour of the Basque Country is a cycle stage race held in the Autonomous Community of the Basque Country.

5 profiles adapted to Magnytour

boardgame.name: Silent Mill
boardgame.description:
A card-based expansion for Four against Darkness, for levels 2-4. Instead of rolling on tables to generate places and encounters, the player(s) draw cards from a deck and apply the results to the adventure.
The deck features a standalone adventure in which the heroes explore a haunted mill that has been taken over by monsters.

boardgame.name: Senran Kagura: Portrait of Girls
Senran Kagura: Shōjo-tachi no Shin'ei
Senran Kagura: Shoujotachi no Shinei
Senran Kagura: Skirting Shadows
閃乱カグラ：少女達の真影
boardgame.description: Senran Kagura: Portrait of Girls (閃乱カグラ：少女達の真影 Senran Kagura: Shoujotachi no Shinei) is a side scrolling action game for the Nintendo 3DS. The player assumes control of 5 different female ninja characters. The more they are damaged by enemies, the more their clothes are torn off. The game also features erotic elements that use the features of the Nintendo 3DS system such as stereoscopic, 3D cleavage along with 3D images of other body parts. Senran Kagura features character designs from Nan Yaegashi and scenario work from Yukinori Kitajima.

boardgame.name: EXITE Box: Asteroid Alert
boardgame.description:
Do you have time to stop the asteroid that is heading for earth, before it is too late?

Escape room in a box.

The EXITE Box game concept combines the concrete objects and aids included in the package with the possibilities offered by the environment, the Internet and various media and means of communication. This multiplatform escape room game fits in a box, but there is much more.

boardgame.name: Arena PvP
boardgame.description:
Arena PvP is a fantasy themed card game in wich you are going to embody a hero, equip items, conjure blessings, casts curses and control game events that will lead you to defeat your opponents.

In Arena PvP you will choose a pre-constructed hero's deck to quickly start playing. Each deck has it's own strategies and synergies. Then, if you want more complex gameplays, just create your own deck by combining any card.

Arena PvP is designed to bring you the Trading Card Game experience within a cheap box.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Viticulture: BGExpansions Full Upgrade Kit
boardgame.description:
Complete set for Viticulture, with all the tokens you need to play the base game and the Essential Edition (1-6 players). The perfect components for your Tuscan winery!

This pack includes wooden structure miniatures and 3D tokens in 6 colors, one for each player: orange, purple, yellow, blue, white and green.

Contents (103 pieces):

Wooden Structure Tokens (48 - 8 of each color):
6 Big Cellars
6 Small Cellars
6 Cottages
6 Irrigation Buildings
6 Tasting Rooms
6 Trellis Tokens
6 Windmills
6 Yokes




Other tokens (55):
36 Star Tokens (6 of each color)
6 Wake-up Tokens (Roosters)
6 Victory Point Tokens (Corks)
6 Payment Tracker Tokens (Wine Bottles)
1 First Player Token (Grapes)



—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: In Deo Veritas: Captain General – Wargaming the Age of Marlborough and the Great Northern War
boardgame.description:
In Europe, the first two decades of the eighteenth century were characterised by almost constant warfare. Western and Central Europe had been involved in the Nine Years’ War that ended in 1697. The peace was shortlived and by 1701 Western Europe was once again plunged into a new conflict, the War of Spanish Succession. Elsewhere, Denmark, Russia, Saxony and eventually Prussia all sought to dismember the Swedish Empire and share it amongst themselves. This conflict, known as the Great Northern War, was to last over twenty years.

Designed to refight the battles of the period, In Deo Veritas: Captain General is an expansion book for the popular rule set In Deo Veritas. The rules focus on the command decisions needed to maintain the motivation of the army. The battle scenarios offer the player a series of different challenges from the wars of the early eighteenth century.

Battles are played at the brigade level with all major elements on 75mm/3" wide bases. Using smaller scale figures (6-15mm) lets players give their units a realistic feel. The ground scale of 1" = 40yds means the typical 6ft x 4 ft table is large enough to accommodate most battles of the period.

Most players will already have everything needed to play (d6, tape measure and a deck of cards). More scenarios and game support will become available in the future.

To learn the rules will take 2 hours or so using some of the smaller battles. Once you have become familiar with the core elements then your games will flow more quickly and a larger battle such as Blenheim should last for 3-4 hours depending on the arrival of the reinforcements.

Nothing is certain, but generals that hone their skills are more likely to be victorious.

You will need a copy of In Deo Veritas: Fast Play Rules for Exciting Seventeenth Century Battles in Smaller Scales to use this book.

—description from the publisher's website
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: War of the Spanish Succession
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: In Deo Veritas: Fast Play Rules for Exciting Seventeenth Century Battles in Smaller Scales

boardgame.name: Puppy Power
boardgame.description:
Puppy Power is a free print&play 52-card puzzle game for 1 (solo) or 2 players (head to head)

The puppy's stuff is all over the place and you have to order all of it exactly right using a mancala style system.

Both players get a set of 5 Puppy Stuff cards which they put face-up in this pattern : 2 cards above the Puppy card, 1 to the right, 1 at the bottom and 1 to the left.

Both players draw an Order card.

On his turn the player must pick-up all Puppy Stuff cards from 1 Location and redistribute all the cards in a clockwise order from the Location where he picked them up.

Of the Puppy Stuff card(s) picked up in a Location, exactly 1 Puppy Stuff card must be dropped in the next Location clockwise, the next Puppy Stuff card in the next Location clockwise and so on until there are no more Puppy Stuff cards to drop

If the player's Order card pattern now matches with the Puppy Stuff cards in front of him, he has succeeded in his ordering task and that player scores the Order card by putting it to the side and drawing another Order card.

The first player to score 5 Order cards wins the game.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: A Forest of Whispering Speakers
boardgame.description:
Author's description:

A dungeon escape inspired by the original 1980 Rogue video game (not just the rogue-like genre), and Neill Blomkamp's short film Zygote.

boardgame.name: Heeey! Park-Boy
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





Yuu-Boy needs your help!

Heeey! Park-Boy is a casual simulation/adventure game heavily inspired by early 2000s era PS2/Gamecube titles like Chibi-Robo and Katamari Damacy

Flowers are power!

After crashing in an abandoned park, Yuu-Boy must get home the only way he knows how- by making people happy! It's now your job to spruce up an old run down city park and return happiness to planet earth, one flower at a time!

Put the pedal to the metal!

Use Yuu-Boys amazing water guns to boost, jump and fly across your new playground! Unlock upgrades to make you the greatest flower water-er of all time!

Source: The Developer Website.


User summary

Developed by Trey Brown.

boardgame.name: My Pleasure
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





Due to his own mistakes, the young protagonist of the game is forced to spend some time outside of his house after a quarrel with his father. Yesterday, he led a lavish life filled with fun and parties with friends. However, he must now live under someone else's roof and figure out how not to die of boredom until he returns home. Can he come up with a plan to return to back to his exuberant life?
Reminder: in this game, the choices made by the player can have a significant impact on the development of the plot. Be careful and remember that you can always save the game in order to later load your save and try to make another choice.

Source: The Developer Patreon Website.

boardgame.name: Collapsing Now
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurp:

DO THE COLLAPSE!

Some are careful, others are chaotic. Some are new, others old. Some are ruthlessly calculating and logical, others have only the barest acquaintance with sanity. But they’re all in the shadows, they’re all dangerous, and they’re all things you need to know.

Collapsing Now details ten organizations poised to make an impact on the ever-shifting structures of the Sixth World—ten organizations shadowrunners could encounter. Maybe they’ll be helpful, maybe harmful, maybe both, but whatever the case, runners need to know what they’re about. Because the last thing a good runner ever wants to be is surprised.

'Collapsing Now is a Runner Resource bookfor Shadowrun, Sixth World.

boardgame.name: Open Wide!
boardgame.description: Some happy hippos need your help pulling their big rotten teeth. In this children's game players take turns spinning the spinner onto one of the 6 hippos and pulling 1 of their 4 teeth if they have any. If a player spins a hippo without any teeth, that player must help the hippo by giving it 4 new teeth. Players spin until their corner holds 6, 8, or 13 of the 24 teeth depending on number of players.

boardgame.name: Hi Ho Mother Goose VCR Game
boardgame.description:
A children's game in the Hi Ho series alongside Hi Ho Cherry-O, Hi Ho Cherry-O VCR Game, Hi Ho Alphabet, and Hi Ho Color Go Round.

A VCR game about nursery rhymes with 3 different play sessions on the tape and random elements to ensure the game plays different even during the same section of the tape. Hi Ho Mother Goose contains 13 favorite nursery rhymes portrayed via puppets and cartoons. Players watch the nursery rhyme segments and listen for Mother Goose's instructions on matching cards to the rhymes and then spinning the spinner to take or give matching cards, with the player holding Mother Goose's card at the end of the session wins.

boardgame.name: nickname party!
boardgame.description:
Playing Games, You can call your opponet in many diffrent ways, and get close to them.
"nickname" was born out of the thoughts of middle school girl "Nanana Kudo". and We're back to the "nickname party!"

"Alien Paul, Give me the UFO!"
"PRINCESS Jack, Please give me some GLASS SHOES."

That's how each of you call each other in different ways during the game.
And the player with the most nickname groups wins.

The card set in the nickname consists of one nickname card and four item cards.

The nickname card is placed in the middle of the table, and all the item cards in the nickname category used in this game are shuffled and divided into equal.

The player should request an item card at least once to anyone on his or her turn, that is currently the same nickname category not in hands.

Through this, the information that player has at least one item card in the some nickname category is exposed to others.
However, bluffing is prohibited for requesting an item card in the player's hand.

If the request is successful, that player can decide whether to continue the request or pass.

It doesn't matter if the player changes the opponent to someone else when they keep requesting.

During the game, if the player has all four item cards of the same nickname category in their hand, they will immediately declare their achievement and bring the nickname card that the player put in the center of the table. And the nickname item cards are piled up together.

The game ends when all the nickname cards placed in the center of the table are seated in front of someone.

The person who has the most nickname sets in front of him wins.

boardgame.name: Kandagawa Jet Girls
boardgame.description:
Welcome to tokyojetracing.com, your launch pad for all things wet, fast, and frantic! Jet racing has taken Tokyo by storm, and we're here to bring you up to speed.
In this unique sport, two partners ride a jet machine, the latest in watercraft technology, through courses set up across urban riverways. They compete not only in speed and maneuvering, but in marksmanship—the Jetter steers the craft, while the Shooter fires various types of water weapons at their opponents. Each league-approved jet machine is equipped with special sensors, which register hits from opposing Shooters and shut down temporarily if they take too many. (Of course, safety comes first, and that's why each craft is also equipped with advanced energy shields, which protect the racers from both shots and collisions.)
Aboard these phenomenal machines, the league's Jetters and Shooters are ready to amaze you. Take a look around the site, and learn more about the sport, the athletes, and their tools and tricks. See you out on the course!

Source: The Game Website.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 NAVGTR Award Best Racing Game of the Year Nominee
boardgame.videogameversion: Japanese PS4 DX Jet Pack Edition
boardgame.videogameexpansion: Kandagawa Jet Girls — SENRAN KAGURA Character Pass
boardgame.videogameversion: North American PS4 Racing Hearts Edition

boardgame.name: Kandagawa Jet Girls — SENRAN KAGURA Character Pass
boardgame.description:
This special set adds 8 characters from the SENRAN KAGURA series to Kandagawa Jet Girls as playable characters. Each playable character also comes with various in-game items and accessories.

Set Contents

Yumi & Asuka Character Set
Ikaruga & Yomi Character Set
Homura & Hikage Character Set
Murasaki & Mirai Character Set


Notification
The contents of this set are also available for individual purchase.

boardgame.name: Valeria le royaume: La saga de Ténébréon
Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Darksworn
Valeria: Königreich der Karten – Dunkelschreck
boardgame.description:
The goal of Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Darksworn is to introduce co-operative play into the Valeria world through groups of related books called Sagas. These books will lead the players through a story that unfolds during the game and offers greater immersion into the Valeria setting. New rules and cards will be introduced in each book, some lasting only through the current book and some persisting through the unfolding Saga, somewhat like a "legacy game".

Darksworn uses six book-decks to tell a story of wonder, sacrifice, and adventure as you explore the territory west of Valeria and encounter a darkness that cannot go unchecked. Each book presents you with a set of new rules and several tasks that must be completed by your gaming group in order to advance to the next book in the saga. Within each book you'll find special boons to assist you and powerful monsters to challenge you. Your team will have to strike a balance between building effective tableaus of citizens that will allow you to complete the tasks and defending the decreasing center stacks of citizens that are the health of your kingdom.

The play area for Darksworn is much the same as an ordinary game of Valeria: Card Kingdoms, but there are some notable changes. The story board sits above the monster row. This is where each book's story and challenges are presented, where new rules are displayed, and where citizens captured by monster attacks languish in a dark oubliette. Walls provide additional protection from the attacking monsters, but if they make it past the walls, your citizen stacks are going to suffer. At the bottom of the play area is the Blessings Board where your devotion to the radiance of Aquila can grant you special powers, free captured citizens, and even rebuild fallen walls. If any of the monsters make it through to the Blessings Board, however, all is lost.
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Cardboard Time Episode 38 - Valeria Card Kingdoms: Darksworn and an interview with Adam Collins of Eat Lunch & Board Game and Bearded Board Games

boardgame.name: Sketchy Ski Lifts
boardgame.description:
In Sketchy Ski Lifts, players are responsible for constructing a network of ski lifts to transport guests between mountain lodges.

The game takes place over 12 rounds, each representing a month of a year-long construction project. Each round, dice dictate where players may build stations and poles for their ski lifts that month. Players may also trim forests or invest in upgrades for future rounds.

Every 6 months, an Opening Day occurs where players can connect their network with cables and receive points depending on how long it takes to travel between each pair of lodges. After the second Opening Day, the winner is the player with the lowest total score.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Plażing: roll&write
boardgame.description:
The game is a compact (roll & write) version of Plażing: parawany w dłoń game. You roll a dice and you need to draw different shapes to gather different goods from the beach.
The game contains 4 different types of boards.

In each round one of the players roll a dice, then everyone needs to draw a shape which is attached to a number. There are also a few special shapes which can be used additionally.
On the beach there are 3 different goods: shells, amber and stones. The goal is to close areas containing them.
After 10 rounds the game ends. A player who gets the most points wins the game.

boardgame.name: The Quacks of Quedlinburg: The Herb Witches – Ingredient Cases
boardgame.description: 154 cases in matching colors for the ingredients pumpkin, mandrake, garden spider, toadstool, crows skull, african death’s head hawkmoth, ghost’s breath, locoweed and cherry bomb.

5 copper-colored cases for the owl pennies

5 gold-colored cases for the snake pennies

boardgame.description:
41 coin cases in brown with silver locomotives for the 1-coins
20 coin cases in silver with brown barges for the 5-coins

Coin-Cases fits for Brass Birmingham and also for Brass Lancashire

all with the same external dimension for stacking (approx. 3.9cm x 0.3cm)

35 coin cases in copper with black cowboy hat for the 1-coins (approx. 2.9cm x 0.3cm)
20 coin cases in silver with black cow head for the 5-coins (approx. 3.4cm x 0.3cm)

boardgame.name: Albion's Legacy: Character pack
boardgame.description: 12 extra characters, including: Ivanhoe, Peter Pan, Robyn Hood, Blackbeard. 12 extra artifacts and 4 terrains related to the new characters. No additional rules.

boardgame.name: Advanced Gunnery
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Locked and Loaded

Get new options for breaking out the big guns with your Starfinder heroes with over a dozen character options, including the artillerist character theme with new abilities like traversing fire and component targeting. Plus unleash massive firepower with new spells like gravity bullet and new feats like Overwatch, Improved Suppressing Fire, and Unholstering Strike!

boardgame.name: Niezły Blef
boardgame.description:
In Niezły Blef one of the players writes down truthful answer to the drawn question. Second one presents the question and the answer to the rest. The answer presented does not have to match with original answer. All the other players decide whether it is a truth or a bluff. Players get a point if they guessed correctly. The bluffing player gets a point for each incorrect answer.

The game ends after three rounds of everyone being a crook.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Wznieś się na wyżyny kreatywności, by w sprytny sposób zwieść przeciwników i zwyciężyć w tej imprezowej grze blefu i domysłów!

Jeden z graczy zapisuje odpowiedź na zadane pytanie, drugi zaś przedstawia ją pozostałym uczestnikom rozgrywki. Sęk w tym, że jego wersja może, ale nie musi być zgodna z oryginałem! Pozostali gracze decydują, czy ktoś tu właśnie próbuje sprowadzić ich na manowce, czy może sztuczka polega na braku sztuczki…

Głosujcie!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: MaximumHP (Issue #004 - 1e)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Maximum HP is a tabletop RPG 'zine relating to the world's favorite tabletop game regarding to Dragons and Dungeons. For 1E.
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: MaximumHP (Issue #004 - 5e)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Maximum HP is a tabletop RPG 'zine relating to the world's favorite tabletop game regarding to Dragons and Dungeons. For 5E.

boardgame.name: The Pit in the Forest
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

In Claine Forest near Padduck Village there has appeared a pit. No-one knows where it came from, it just did. It is not so deep that you cannot see the bottom, but people fear it and avoid it. No-one who has climbed into it has come back, having been dragged beneath the surface by unseen hands.

A necromancer has come to the forest, seeking the pit. She does not quite know what she expects from it, but what she hopes for is protection from death.

Player-characters may wish to get involved, and thus this constitutes an adventure for old-school systems, for 5-6 PCs of 2nd level 2 or slightly fewer of 3rd. The PCs won’t necessarily all die, and the players will almost certainly survive.

boardgame.name: Threepia
boardgame.description:
Threepia explores the realm of our mind, color, and shape to create a simple stimulating puzzle card game that transcends both age and languages. You can learn to play the game within minutes and be engrossed for hours.

Before starting the game, players must set a game grid by randomly picking4 cards from the deck and form them into a square with the different colors and shapes facing upward.

Inspired by International Chess, each player is given a total of 3 mins for the entire game. Players get 3 cards at the start and take turns to form a roll of at least3 matching shapes or colors by stacking 1 card from their hand onto the game grid. Players who do not have any stackable card will have to end their turn by drawing a card.

The player starts their countdown at the start of their turn and pause the timer at the end of their turn, the countdown resumes when it's come around to the same player. The game ends for the player when their clock runs out, while others continue to finish the game with their remaining time. When the time runs out for everyone, the player with the highest score wins!

Points are awarded for each roll of 3 matching shapes or colors at the end of the player’s turn. Points are also awarded when the player finishes all the cards in their hand. The player will also need to draw 3 more cards to continue playing.

Players get extra points by forming both vertical and horizontal combo in a single turn. Combos can be combined to get even more points!

There are a variety of starting game grids to choose from and many other ways to play Threepia.

-description from publisher

listing.notes: Free shipping worldwide. Shipment with take between 5 to 21 days, subject to country location. Shipment tracking number will also be provided.

boardgame.name: Abandoned District
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Speed up your game prep with the Abandoned District Mini Adventure Pack!

Any GM knows getting ready for a session takes a lot of time and creative juice. The Abandoned District speeds up prep time and helps with idea generation. In this book, you'll find a collection of mini-adventures that give you everything you need to build sessions in the malignant and abandoned section of a magical city.

You get maps, 5 room dungeons and NPCs with personalities (they all need something). Each mini-adventure ends with more hooks to keep play going. They're perfect when you need to speed up your planning.

Imagine taking your players through these new locations:

Isolated Fort, Abandoned Square, Occult Park, Rioting Prison, Runaway Soldiers, Rotten Church


This pack contains these mini-adventures:

"The Light Beam," "Barricades in the Dark," "Forest Chess," "A Prison Moon," "The Ghost Traitor," and "Shards of Unreality"


Features:

Seven NPCs, all tied to an abandoned, malignant neighborhood — and they all have problems that need solved and quests for the players
Six locations with maps that can be dropped into any adventure that takes place in an area focused on abandoned buildings and dark shadows
A d20 random table, with even more story starters
A neighborhood map that ties all the locations together
A story-based prologue to add flavor

boardgame.name: The Market District
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Make your riches fast!
Speed up your adventure prep time with the Market District People Pack, a highly-organized collection of mini-adventures, maps, NPCs and plot hooks for creative GMs. Everything takes place near the market square of a magical city.

Imagine taking your players through these new locations:

Market Square, Clothiers’ Guild, Jeweler Shop, Department Store, Merchant’s House, Exclusive Hotel
But these aren’t normal locations. Everything is going wrong. It might be the revenge of a planar entity or hidden pocket dimensions behind the bedding department. Every location gives you ideas to throw at your players, and people with adventure hooks.

This pack contains these mini-adventures:

"War of the Rich," "The Crooked Clothier," "Gemstone of Power," "The Portal Department," "Merchant's Curse," "Hotel Planar Bandits"


Features:

Seven NPCs, all tied to a market district — and they all have problems that need solved and quests for the players
Six locations with maps that can be dropped into any adventure that takes place in an area focused on abandoned buildings and dark shadows
A d20 random table, with even more story starters
A neighborhood map that ties all the locations together
A story-based prologue to add flavor

boardgame.name: Wealthy District
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Speed up your game prep with the Wealthy District Mini Adventure Pack!

Any GM knows getting ready for a session takes a lot of time and creative juice. The Wealthy District speeds up prep time and helps with idea generation. In this book, you'll find a collection of mini-adventures that give you everything you need to build sessions in the wealthy part of a magical city.

You get maps, 5 room dungeons and NPCs with personalities (they all need something). Each mini-adventure ends with more hooks to keep play going. They're perfect when you need to speed up your planning.

Imagine taking your players through these wealthy locations:

Parliament, Spellcaster Gardens, Antique Store, Infested Greenhouse, Witch Manor, Time-Cursed Library


This pack contains these mini-adventures:

"The Parliament Problem," "Death in Miniature," "The Clockwork Job," "Plants from Hell," "The Witch Fog," and "A Worm in the Books"


Features:

Seven NPCs, all tied to a wealthy, exclusive neighborhood — and they all have problems that need solved and quests for the players
Six locations with maps that can be dropped into any adventure that takes place in an area focused on abandoned buildings and dark shadows

boardgame.name: The Rough Part of Town
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Speed up your game prep with the Rough Part of Town!

Ignored by most, this neighborhood’s crumbling cobblestones form jagged paths, trash fills its alleyways, and sad people leer from its broken windows. Illegal things can be found easily in this vicious neighborhood largely ignored by the city’s constables. It calls to adventurers willing to chance its dark streets and powerful underworld leaders.

THE ROUGH PART OF TOWN is a system-agnostic collection of locations, NPCs and story starters for GMs and Players alike. You'll find a collection of mini-adventures that gives you everything you need to run quick sessions inside a rough neighborhood in a magical city.

Complete with maps, 5 room dungeons, and NPCs with personalities (they all need something). The book features a unique and easy-to-reference layout to help GMs start and build adventures. And it’s not just for GMs! Players will find the book helpful for giving their characters deep backstory.

You get these locations:

Thieves' Den, Cursed Warehouse, Butchers' Guild, Abandoned Arena, City Hospital, Occult Bookstore


You also get these mini adventures:

"The Carriage Heist," "The Sickness from Hell," "To Steal from Death," "Gangs on the Run," "Killer and Witness," and "Laboratory Terror"


Features:

Seven NPCs, all tied to a rough part of the city — and they all have problems that need solved and quests for the players

A d20 random table, with even more story starters

boardgame.name: The Theater District
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

At night, the torchlit passages near the theater are filled with people in states of inebriation and undress. The buildings ring with the songs of countless bards, and the taverns overflow onto the cobblestone streets. But behind the joyful illusion, dark currents move within the Theater District. Adventurers can find themselves entranced by promise and might be memorialized forever—so long as they’re careful not to lose their way.

THE THEATER DISTRICT is a system-agnostic collection of locations, NPCs and story starters for GMs and Players alike. Complete with maps, descriptions, and NPCs that are tied to an entertainment district in a late medieval city. The book features a unique and easy-to-reference layout to help GMs start and build adventures. And it’s not just for GMs! Players will find the book helpful for giving their characters deep backstory.

You get these locations:

Haunted Theater, Bards' Flophouse, Gamblers' Palace, Village Green, Bathhouse, Wizard's Manse


This pack contains these mini-adventures:

"The Spirit Upstairs," "Bard's Lament," "Revenge Heist," "The Sports Murders," "Water Problems," and "Cage of Ruby"


Features:

A d20 random table, with even more story starters

boardgame.name: Butchers' Guild Map + NPC Set
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"These streets are mine. These people are mine."

The home of the Butchers' Guild is a great stone slab of a building in the center of the rough part of town. The front steps are broad and big as pigs' feet, welcoming anyone in the Hall's cluster of Guild offices, or its boisterous tavern upstairs.

This is a system-agnostic location, complete with descriptions, map, NPC and story-starters for GMs and Players alike. The location features a unique and easy-to-reference layout to help GMs start and build adventures. And it’s not just for GMs! Certain players will find the location helpful for giving their characters deep backstory.

NOTE: The Butchers' Guild is excerpted from THE ROUGH PART OF TOWN Map+NPC Pack. If you liked the Butchers' Guild, check out the Rough Part of Town for even more locations nearby!

boardgame.name: Uranus!
boardgame.description:
You are the ruler of one of six alien races, each with their own special powers, which inhabit the lesser-known moons of Uranus. Until recently, your people have been living peacefully in underground dwellings to protect themselves from the noxious gases on the surface. But now you are besieged by violent and increasingly frequent asteroid attacks, which are causing irreparable damage and threatening your very existence.

Working together with the other rulers, you must rally the troops to build infrastructure and develop technologies that will protect you from the asteroids and will ultimately allow you to escape. Use your race’s special powers to help you and your neighbouring moons, which are suffering the same fate, to settle on Uranus before your moons explode.

This is a co-operative game: players work together to try to beat the game. Players win the game if they manage to get all of the moon races housed in completed modules on Uranus before the moons explode. No race must be left behind.

Each round has four phases that must be completed in order. Players play simultaneously within each phase, but wait until all players have finished a phase before moving on together to the next.

Phase 1: Asteroid track. If the asteroid track marker lands on an asteroid attack, the next attack is carried out. Areas of moons are damaged and 'go dark' making these sections unusable.

Phase 2: Mine and transport. Each mine on a player's moon produces a moon rock of the appropriate colour. The rocks are then transported along tunnel and grouped together in connected networks.

Phase 3: Use and remove. Groups of moon rocks are used together towards a single project. Progress is marked on the project board. Players may get ready to build tunnels and mines, construct launchpads and fortifications, load up their space gun or work towards developing different technologies. Each technology helps the players to progress in the game.

Phase 4: Build and activate. Completed projects can now be constructed on your moon. Mines may be built or fortified. Tunnels constructed or removed. Networks will change as your need for different groupings of resources changes.

When all players have discovered spaceship technology and habitation modules are constructed on Uranus, players may travel to Uranus. This is a race against time.

—description from the publisher

"My friends of silk, we shall conquer."

The owner of the Clothiers Guild is a bit crazy and a lot powerful. He keeps two powerful friends in the basement, and he's planning to take over the city.

This is a system-agnostic location designed to cut down your GM prep time. It comes complete with a map, descriptions, an NPC and quests. And no more hard-to-reference pages! The Clothiers Guild is an easy prompt for game ideas.

boardgame.name: Sailors' Tavern Map + NPC Set
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"I understand yer frustrations. This drink's on me."

Concealed along a quiet stretch of Sailors' Alley is one of its most popular taverns, a yellowing wooden row house called the Lonely Anchor. Inside is an enormous fireplace and a room of people, all arguing or playing dice at cheap wooden tables or the long bar at the back. Many grumbling old captains and sailors drink here, and one of these days they'll find a way to address their grievances..

This is a system-agnostic location, complete with descriptions, map, NPC and story-starters for GMs and Players alike. The location features a unique and easy-to-reference layout to help GMs start and build adventures. And it’s not just for GMs!
